14,\n    lineHeight: 20,\n    textAlign: \"center\",\n  },\n});\n","size_bytes":18090},"components/ScreenKeyboardAwareScrollView.tsx":{"content":"import { Platform, StyleSheet } from \"react-native\";\nimport {\n  KeyboardAwareScrollView,\n  KeyboardAwareScrollViewProps,\n} from \"react-native-keyboard-controller\";\n\nimport { useTheme } from \"@/hooks/useTheme\";\nimport { useScreenInsets } from \"@/hooks/useScreenInsets\";\nimport { Spacing } from \"@/constants/theme\";\nimport { ScreenScrollView } from \"./ScreenScrollView\";\n\nexport function ScreenKeyboardAwareScrollView({\n  children,\n  contentContainerStyle,\n  style,\n  keyboardShouldPersistTaps = \"handled\",\n  ...scrollViewProps\n}: KeyboardAwareScrollViewProps) {\n  const { theme } = useTheme();\n  const { paddingTop, paddingBottom, scrollInsetBottom } = useScreenInsets();\n\n  /**\n   * KeyboardAwareScrollView isn't compatible with web (it relies on native APIs), so the code falls back to ScreenScrollView on web to avoid runtime errors.\n   */\n  if (Platform.OS === \"web\") {\n    return (\n      <ScreenScrollView\n        style={style}\n        contentContainerStyle={contentContainerStyle}\n        keyboardShouldPersistTaps={keyboardShouldPersistTaps}\n        {...scrollViewProps}\n      >\n        {children}\n      </ScreenScrollView>\n    );\n  }\n\n  return (\n    <KeyboardAwareScrollView\n      style={[\n        styles.container,\n        { backgroundColor: theme.backgroundRoot },\n        style,\n      ]}\n      contentContainerStyle={[\n        {\n          paddingTop,\n          paddingBottom,\n        },\n        styles.contentContainer,\n        contentContainerStyle,\n      ]}\n      scrollIndicatorInsets={{ bottom: scrollInsetBottom }}\n      keyboardShouldPersistTaps={keyboardShouldPersistTaps}\n      {...scrollViewProps}\n    >\n      {children}\n    </KeyboardAwareScrollView>\n  );\n}\n\nconst styles = StyleSheet.create({\n  container: {\n    flex: 1,\n  },\n  contentContainer: {\n    paddingHorizontal: Spacing.xl,\n  },\n});\n","size_bytes":1813},"design_guidelines.md":{"content":"# Offroad Recovery App - Design Guidelines\n\n## Architecture Decisions\n\n### Authentication\n**Auth Required** - The app needs user accounts for:\n- Rescue coordination with nearby offroaders\n- Profile visibility when requesting help\n- Saving favorite guides and recovery history\n\n**Implementation:**\n- Use SSO (Apple Sign-In for iOS, Google Sign-In for cross-platform)\n- Login/signup screens with privacy policy & terms of service links\n- Profile screen with:\n  - User-customizable avatar (generate 4 rugged offroad-themed avatars: jeep silhouette, mountain terrain, tire tracks, compass)\n  - Display name and vehicle type fields\n  - Log out and delete account options (nested under Settings > Account)\n\n### Navigation\n**Tab Navigation** (4 tabs)\n\n**Tab Structure:**\n1. **Guides** - Browse self-recovery guides by category\n2. **AI Scan** - Upload photos for AI-powered recovery analysis\n3. **Nearby** - Map view of nearby offroaders who can assist\n4. **Profile** - User settings, saved guides\n\n### Screen Specifications\n\n#### 1. Guides Screen (Home Tab)\n- **Purpose:** Browse categorized self-recovery guides, accessible offline\n- **Layout:**\n  - Transparent header with search bar (right button: filter icon)\n  - Scrollable content with category cards\n  - Safe area: top = headerHeight + Spacing.xl, bottom = tabBarHeight + Spacing.xl\n- **Components:**\n  - Search bar in header\n  - Category cards: \"Stuck in Mud,\" \"Sand Recovery,\" \"Rock Crawling,\" \"Mechanical Issues,\" \"Winching,\" \"Tire Repairs\"\n  - Each card shows category icon, title, number of guides\n  - Tapping card navigates to guide list (stack navigation)\n- **Offline:** Cache all guide content locally\n\n#### 2. Guide Detail Screen (Modal from Guides)\n- **Purpose:** View step-by-step recovery instructions\n- **Layout:**\n  - Default navigation header (left: back, right: bookmark icon)\n  - Scrollable content with large text and diagrams\n  - Safe area: top = Spacing.xl, bottom = insets.bottom + Spacing.xl\n- **Components:**\n  - Guide title and difficulty badge\n  - Required equipment list with checkboxes\n  - Numbered step cards with illustrations\n  - Safety warning callouts (yellow background)\n  - \"Mark as completed\" button at bottom\n\n#### 3. AI Scan Screen (Tab 2)\n- **Purpose:** Upload vehicle/situation photos for AI analysis\n- **Layout:**\n  - Transparent header with title \"AI Recovery Scan\"\n  - Scrollable content area\n  - Safe area: top = headerHeight + Spacing.xl, bottom = tabBarHeight + Spacing.xl\n- **Components:**\n  - Large camera button with \"Take Photo\" label\n  - \"Upload from Gallery\" secondary button\n  - Recent scans list (thumbnail, timestamp, situation type)\n  - Empty state: illustration of phone camera with instructions\n- **Flow:** After photo capture → AI Analysis Results screen (stack navigation)\n\n#### 4. AI Analysis Results Screen (Stack from AI Scan)\n- **Purpose:** Display AI-generated recovery recommendations\n- **Layout:**\n  - Default header (left: back, right: share icon)\n  - Scrollable content\n  - Safe area: top = Spacing.xl, bottom = insets.bottom + Spacing.xl\n- **Components:**\n  - Uploaded photo preview\n  - Situation summary card (AI-detected issue type)\n  - Recommended recovery procedure (step-by-step)\n  - Difficulty and risk assessment badges\n  - \"Save to Guides\" action button\n  - Disclaimer text: \"AI suggestions - use professional judgment\"\n\n#### 5. Nearby Screen (Tab 3)\n- **Purpose:** Map view of nearby offroaders available to help\n- **Layout:**\n  - Custom header with GPS accuracy indicator (left: location icon, right: refresh button)\n  - Map fills entire screen beneath header\n  - Bottom sheet overlay for offroader details (draggable)\n  - Safe area: map extends under tab bar; bottom sheet respects tabBarHeight + Spacing.xl\n- **Components:**\n  - Map with user location (blue dot) and nearby offroaders (orange pins)\n  - Tapping pin shows offroader card in bottom sheet\n  - Offroader card: avatar, name, vehicle type, distance, contact button\n  - Empty state: \"No offroaders nearby - guides available offline\"\n- **Offline:** Show cached last-known positions with \"Offline\" indicator\n\n#### 6. Profile Screen (Tab 4)\n- **Purpose:** Manage user settings and app preferences\n- **Layout:**\n  - Transparent header with title \"Profile\"\n  - Scrollable form\n  - Safe area: top = headerHeight + Spacing.xl, bottom = tabBarHeight + Spacing.xl\n- **Components:**\n  - Avatar selection (4 preset rugged avatars)\n  - Display name and vehicle type fields\n  - Offline mode toggle\n  - Download guides for offline use button\n  - Settings link (navigates to Settings screen in stack)\n  - Saved guides list\n\n#### 7. Settings Screen (Stack from Profile)\n- **Purpose:** App preferences and account management\n- **Layout:**\n  - Default header (left: back, title: \"Settings\")\n  - Scrollable list\n  - Safe area: top = Spacing.xl, bottom = insets.bottom + Spacing.xl\n- **Components:**\n  - Theme toggle (light/dark - default to high-contrast mode)\n  - Notification preferences\n  - Location sharing permissions\n  - Cache management (\"Clear offline guides\")\n  - Account section: Log out, Delete account (with confirmations)\n  - Privacy policy and terms of service links\n\n## Design System\n\n### Color Palette\n**High-Contrast Outdoor Theme:**\n- Primary: Safety Orange (#FF6B35) - primary actions, critical features\n- Secondary: Trail Brown (#8B4513) - navigation, category headers\n- Accent: GPS Blue (#2196F3) - location indicators, map elements\n- Background: Off-White (#F5F5F5) for light mode, Dark Charcoal (#1E1E1E) for dark mode\n- Success: Forest Green (#2E7D32)\n- Warning: Caution Yellow (#FBC02D)\n- Error: Alert Red (#D32F2F)\n- Text: High contrast black (#000000) or white (#FFFFFF) depending on mode\n- Borders: Medium Gray (#BDBDBD)\n\n### Typography\n- **Headings:** Bold, 24-28pt for outdoor readability\n- **Body:** Regular, 18-20pt (larger than standard for gloved use)\n- **Labels:** Semibold, 16pt\n- **Buttons:** Bold, 18pt\n- Font: System font (San Francisco for iOS, Roboto for Android)\n\n### Touch Targets\n- Minimum 56x56pt for all interactive elements (larger for gloved hands)\n- Card tap areas: full card width, minimum 80pt height\n- Spacing between interactive elements: minimum 16pt\n\n### Visual Feedback\n- All touchable elements scale down slightly (0.95) when pressed\n- Map pins bounce when selected\n- Loading states show pulse animation for offline sync\n\n### Icons\n- Use Feather icons from @expo/vector-icons\n- Icon size: 28pt minimum for visibility\n- Navigation uses outlined style\n\n### Critical Assets\n1. **4 User Avatars** (rugged offroad theme):\n   - Jeep silhouette on mountain background\n   - Topographic map pattern circle\n   - Tire tread pattern circle\n   - Compass rose design\n2. **Category Illustrations:**\n   - Vehicle stuck in mud (brown/orange tones)\n   - Vehicle on rocks (gray/brown tones)\n   - Winch recovery diagram (simple line art)\n   - Tire repair tools (wrench, jack icons)\n3. **Empty States:**\n   - Phone camera with mountain backdrop for AI Scan\n   - Map pin with \"No Signal\" for offline Nearby view\n\n### Accessibility\n- Support dynamic type scaling\n- VoiceOver labels for all interactive elements\n- High contrast mode by default\n- Haptic feedback for critical actions\n- Offline indicators clearly visible (yellow badge with \"Offline\" text)\n- Red/green color combinations avoided; use icons + text labels","size_bytes":7324},"constants/theme.ts":{"content":"import { Platform } from \"react-native\";\n\nconst primary = \"#FF6B35\";\nconst secondary = \"#8B4513\";\nconst accent = \"#2196F3\";\nconst success = \"#2E7D32\";\nconst warning = \"#FBC02D\";\nconst error = \"#D32F2F\";\n\nexport const Colors = {\n  light: {\n    text:   error,\n    border: \"#BDBDBD\",\n    backgroundRoot: \"#F5F5F5\", // Elevation 0\n    backgroundDefault: \"#FFFFFF\", // Elevation 1\n    backgroundSecondary: \"#FAFAFA\", // Elevation 2\n },\n};\n\nexport const Fonts = Platform.select({\n  ios: {\n    /** iOS `UIFontDescriptorSystemDesignDefault` */\n    sans: \"system-ui\",\n    /** iOS `UIFontDescriptorSystemDesignSerif` */\n    serif: \"ui-serif\",\n    /** iOS `UIFontDescriptorSystemDesignRounded` */\n    rounded: \"ui-rounded\",\n    /** iOS `UIFontDescriptorSystemDesignMonospaced` */\n    mono: \"ui-monospace\",\n  },\n  default: {\n    sans: \"normal\",\n    serif: \"serif\",\n    rounded: \"normal\",\n    mono: \"monospace\",\n  },\n  web: {\n    sans: \"system-ui, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif\",\n    serif: \"Georgia, 'Times New Roman', serif\",\n    rounded:\n      \"'SF Pro Rounded', 'Hiragino Maru Gothic ProN', Meiryo, 'MS PGothic', sans-serif\",\n    mono: \"SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Liberation Mono', 'Courier New', monospace\",\n  },\n});\n","size_bytes":2893},"components/ThemedText.tsx":{"content":"import { Text, type TextProps } from \"react-native\";\n\nimport { useTheme } from \"@/hooks/useTheme\";\nimport { Typography } from \"@/constants/theme\";\n\nexport type ThemedTextProps = TextProps & {\n  lightColor?: string;\n  darkColor?: string;\n  type?: \"h1\" | \"h2\" | \"h3\" | \"h4\" | \"body\" | \"small\" | \"link\";\n};\n\nexport default function ThemedText({\n  style,\n  lightColor,\n  darkColor,\n  type = \"body\",\n  ...rest\n}: ThemedTextProps) {\n  const { theme, isDark } = useTheme();\n\n  const getColor = () => {\n    if (isDark && darkColor) {\n      return darkColor;\n    }\n\n    if (!isDark && lightColor) {\n      return lightColor;\n    }\n\n    if (type === \"link\") {\n      return theme.link;\n    }\n\n    return theme.text;\n  };\n\n  const getTypeStyle = () => {\n    switch (type) {\n      case \"h1\":\n        return Typography.h1;\n      case \"h2\":\n        return Typography.h2;\n      case \"h3\":\n        return Typography.h3;\n      case \"h4\":\n        return Typography.h4;\n      case \"body\":\n        return Typography.body;\n      case \"small\":\n        return Typography.small;\n      case \"link\":\n        return Typography.link;\n      default:\n        return Typography.body;\n    }\n  };\n\n  return (\n    <Text style={[{ color: getColor() }, getTypeStyle(), style]} {...rest} />\n  );\n}\n","size_bytes":1259},"utils/storage.ts":{"content":"import AsyncStorage from \"@react-native-async-storage/async-storage\";\n\nconst KEYS = {\n  USER_PROFILE: \"@trailguard/user_profile\",\n  SAVED_GUIDES: \"@trailguard/saved_guides\",\n  EMERGENCY_CONTACTS: \"@trailguard/emergency_contacts\",\n  SCAN_HISTORY: \"@trailguard/scan_history\",\n  HELP_REQUESTS: \"@trailguard/help_requests\",\n  NEARBY_OFFROADERS: \"@trailguard/nearby_offroaders\",\n  COMMUNITY_TIPS: \"@trailguard/community_tips\",\n  CHAT_CONVERSATIONS: \"@trailguard/chat_conversations\",\n  FRIENDS_DATA: \"@trailguard/friends_data\",\n  STATUS_UPDATES: \"@trailguard/status_updates\",\n  FIRST_LAUNCH: \"@trailguard/first_launch\",\n};\n\nexport interface UserProfile {\n  id: string;\n  name: string;\n  vehicleType: string;\n  avatarIndex: number;\n  customPhotoUri?: string;\n  vehicleSpecs?: {\n    make: string;\n    model: string;\n    year: string;\n    modifications: string;\n  };\n  equipment?: string[];\n}\n\nexport interface EmergencyContact {\n  id: string;\n  name: string;\n  phone: string;\n}\n\nexport interface ScanHistoryItem {\n  id: string;\n  imageUri: string;\n  timestamp: number;\n  situationType: string;\n  analysis?: string;\n}\n\nexport interface HelpRequest {\n  id: string;\n  timestamp: number;\n  situation: string;\n  situationLabel: string;\n  description: string;\n  location: {\n    latitude: number;\n    longitude: number;\n  };\n  targetAudience: \"nearby\" | \"contacts\";\n  status: \"active\" | \"resolved\" | \"cancelled\";\n  photos?: string[];\n}\n\nexport interface NearbyOffroader {\n  id: string;\n  name: string;\n  vehicleType: string;\n  location: {\n    latitude: number;\n    longitude: number;\n  };\n  equipment: string[];\n  lastSeen: number;\n}\n\nexport interface CommunityTip {\n  id: string;\n  title: string;\n  description: string;\n  category: \"recovery\" | \"navigation\" | \"trail_condition\" | \"maintenance\" | \"safety\";\n  timestamp: number;\n  location?: {\n    latitude: number;\n    longitude: number;\n    name?: string;\n  };\n  author: {\n    name: string;\n    vehicleType: string;\n  };\n  helpful: number;\n}\n\nexport interface ChatMessage {\n  id: string;\n  senderId: string;\n  senderName: string;\n  text: string;\n  timestamp: number;\n  read: boolean;\n}\n\nexport interface ChatConversation {\n  id: string;\n  participantId: string;\n  participantName: string;\n  participantVehicle: string;\n  messages: ChatMessage[];\n  lastMessageTime: number;\n  unreadCount: number;\n}\n\nexport interface Adventure {\n  id: string;\n  title: string;\n  location: string;\n  timestamp: number;\n  difficulty: \"Easy\" | \"Moderate\" | \"Hard\";\n}\n\nexport interface Friend {\n  id: string;\n  name: string;\n  vehicleType: string;\n  location: {\n    latitude: number;\n    longitude: number;\n  };\n  lastSeen: number;\n  adventures: Adventure[];\n}\n\nexport interface StatusUpdate {\n  id: string;\n  userId: string;\n  userName: string;\n  vehicleType: string;\n  status: \"mobile\" | \"stuck\" | \"recovering\";\n  location?: string;\n  timestamp: number;\n  details?: string;\n}\n\nexport const storage = {\n  async addStatusUpdate(update: StatusUpdate): Promise<void> {\n    const updates = await this.getStatusUpdates();\n    updates.unshift(update);\n    await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.STATUS_UPDATES, JSON.stringify(updates.slice(0, 50)));\n  },\n\n  async getStatusUpdates(): Promise<StatusUpdate[]> {\n    const data = await AsyncStorage.getItem(KEYS.STATUS_UPDATES);\n    return data ? JSON.parse(data) : [];\n  },\n\n  async getRecentUpdates(limit: number = 10): Promise<StatusUpdate[]> {\n    const updates = await this.getStatusUpdates();\n    return updates.slice(0, limit);\n  },\n\n  async getUserProfile(): Promise<UserProfile | null> {\n    try {\n      const data = await AsyncStorage.getItem(KEYS.USER_PROFILE);\n      return data ? JSON.parse(data) : null;\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error loading user profile:\", error);\n      return null;\n    }\n  },\n\n  async saveUserProfile(profile: UserProfile): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.USER_PROFILE, JSON.stringify(profile));\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error saving user profile:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async getSavedGuides(): Promise<string[]> {\n    try {\n      const data = await AsyncStorage.getItem(KEYS.SAVED_GUIDES);\n      return data ? JSON.parse(data) : [];\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error loading saved guides:\", error);\n      return [];\n    }\n  },\n\n  async toggleSavedGuide(guideId: string): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      const saved = await this.getSavedGuides();\n      const index = saved.indexOf(guideId);\n      \n      if (index === -1) {\n        saved.push(guideId);\n      } else {\n        saved.splice(index, 1);\n      }\n      \n      await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.SAVED_GUIDES, JSON.stringify(saved));\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error toggling saved guide:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async getEmergencyContacts(): Promise<EmergencyContact[]> {\n    try {\n      const data = await AsyncStorage.getItem(KEYS.EMERGENCY_CONTACTS);\n      return data ? JSON.parse(data) : [];\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error loading emergency contacts:\", error);\n      return [];\n    }\n  },\n\n  async saveEmergencyContacts(contacts: EmergencyContact[]): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.EMERGENCY_CONTACTS, JSON.stringify(contacts));\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error saving emergency contacts:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async getScanHistory(): Promise<ScanHistoryItem[]> {\n    try {\n      const data = await AsyncStorage.getItem(KEYS.SCAN_HISTORY);\n      return data ? JSON.parse(data) : [];\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error loading scan history:\", error);\n      return [];\n    }\n  },\n\n  async addScanHistory(item: ScanHistoryItem): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      const history = await this.getScanHistory();\n      history.unshift(item);\n      await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.SCAN_HISTORY, JSON.stringify(history.slice(0, 20)));\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error saving scan history:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async getHelpRequests(): Promise<HelpRequest[]> {\n    try {\n      const data = await AsyncStorage.getItem(KEYS.HELP_REQUESTS);\n      return data ? JSON.parse(data) : [];\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error loading help requests:\", error);\n      return [];\n    }\n  },\n\n  async addHelpRequest(request: HelpRequest): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      const requests = await this.getHelpRequests();\n      requests.unshift(request);\n      await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.HELP_REQUESTS, JSON.stringify(requests.slice(0, 50)));\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error saving help request:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async updateHelpRequestStatus(\n    requestId: string,\n    status: \"active\" | \"resolved\" | \"cancelled\"\n  ): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      const requests = await this.getHelpRequests();\n      const index = requests.findIndex((r) => r.id === requestId);\n      if (index !== -1) {\n        requests[index].status = status;\n        await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.HELP_REQUESTS, JSON.stringify(requests));\n      }\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error updating help request:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async getNearbyOffroaders(): Promise<NearbyOffroader[]> {\n    try {\n      const data = await AsyncStorage.getItem(KEYS.NEARBY_OFFROADERS);\n      return data ? JSON.parse(data) : [];\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error loading nearby offroaders:\", error);\n      return [];\n    }\n  },\n\n  async addNearbyOffroader(offroader: NearbyOffroader): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      const offroaders = await this.getNearbyOffroaders();\n      const index = offroaders.findIndex((o) => o.id === offroader.id);\n      \n      if (index !== -1) {\n        offroaders[index] = offroader;\n      } else {\n        offroaders.push(offroader);\n      }\n      \n      await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.NEARBY_OFFROADERS, JSON.stringify(offroaders));\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error adding nearby offroader:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async removeOldOffroaders(maxAgeMinutes: number = 30): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      const offroaders = await this.getNearbyOffroaders();\n      const cutoffTime = Date.now() - maxAgeMinutes * 60 * 1000;\n      const activeOffroaders = offroaders.filter((o) => o.lastSeen > cutoffTime);\n      await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.NEARBY_OFFROADERS, JSON.stringify(activeOffroaders));\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error removing old offroaders:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async getCommunityTips(): Promise<CommunityTip[]> {\n    try {\n      const data = await AsyncStorage.getItem(KEYS.COMMUNITY_TIPS);\n      const tips = data ? JSON.parse(data) : [];\n      return tips.sort((a: CommunityTip, b: CommunityTip) => b.timestamp - a.timestamp);\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error loading community tips:\", error);\n      return [];\n    }\n  },\n\n  async saveCommunityTip(tip: CommunityTip): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      const tips = await this.getCommunityTips();\n      tips.unshift(tip);\n      await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.COMMUNITY_TIPS, JSON.stringify(tips));\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error saving community tip:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async markTipAsHelpful(tipId: string): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      const tips = await this.getCommunityTips();\n      const index = tips.findIndex((t) => t.id === tipId);\n      if (index !== -1) {\n        tips[index].helpful += 1;\n        await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.COMMUNITY_TIPS, JSON.stringify(tips));\n      }\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error marking tip as helpful:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async getChatConversations(): Promise<ChatConversation[]> {\n    try {\n      const data = await AsyncStorage.getItem(KEYS.CHAT_CONVERSATIONS);\n      return data ? JSON.parse(data) : [];\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error loading chat conversations:\", error);\n      return [];\n    }\n  },\n\n  async getConversation(participantId: string): Promise<ChatConversation | null> {\n    try {\n      const conversations = await this.getChatConversations();\n      return conversations.find((c) => c.participantId === participantId) || null;\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error loading conversation:\", error);\n      return null;\n    }\n  },\n\n  async createOrUpdateConversation(\n    participantId: string,\n    participantName: string,\n    participantVehicle: string\n  ): Promise<ChatConversation> {\n    try {\n      const data = await AsyncStorage.getItem(KEYS.CHAT_CONVERSATIONS);\n      const conversations: ChatConversation[] = data ? JSON.parse(data) : [];\n      const index = conversations.findIndex((c) => c.participantId === participantId);\n\n      if (index !== -1) {\n        return conversations[index];\n      }\n\n      const newConversation: ChatConversation = {\n        id: `conv_${Date.now()}_${participantId}`,\n        participantId,\n        participantName,\n        participantVehicle,\n        messages: [],\n        lastMessageTime: Date.now(),\n        unreadCount: 0,\n      };\n      \n      conversations.push(newConversation);\n      await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.CHAT_CONVERSATIONS, JSON.stringify(conversations));\n      \n      return newConversation;\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error creating conversation:\", error);\n      throw error;\n    }\n  },\n\n  async sendMessage(\n    participantId: string,\n    participantName: string,\n    participantVehicle: string,\n    senderId: string,\n    senderName: string,\n    text: string\n  ): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      const data = await AsyncStorage.getItem(KEYS.CHAT_CONVERSATIONS);\n      const conversations: ChatConversation[] = data ? JSON.parse(data) : [];\n      let index = conversations.findIndex((c) => c.participantId === participantId);\n\n      if (index === -1) {\n        const newConversation: ChatConversation = {\n          id: `conv_${Date.now()}_${participantId}`,\n          participantId,\n          participantName,\n          participantVehicle,\n          messages: [],\n          lastMessageTime: Date.now(),\n          unreadCount: 0,\n        };\n        conversations.push(newConversation);\n        index = conversations.length - 1;\n      }\n\n      const message: ChatMessage = {\n        id: `msg_${Date.now()}`,\n        senderId,\n        senderName,\n        text,\n        timestamp: Date.now(),\n        read: false,\n      };\n\n      conversations[index].messages.push(message);\n      conversations[index].lastMessageTime = message.timestamp;\n\n      await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.CHAT_CONVERSATIONS, JSON.stringify(conversations));\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error sending message:\", error);\n      throw error;\n    }\n  },\n\n  async markMessagesAsRead(participantId: string, currentUserId: string): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      const data = await AsyncStorage.getItem(KEYS.CHAT_CONVERSATIONS);\n      const conversations: ChatConversation[] = data ? JSON.parse(data) : [];\n      const index = conversations.findIndex((c) => c.participantId === participantId);\n\n      if (index !== -1) {\n        let hasUnread = false;\n        conversations[index].messages.forEach((msg) => {\n          if (msg.senderId !== currentUserId && !msg.read) {\n            msg.read = true;\n            hasUnread = true;\n          }\n        });\n        \n        if (hasUnread) {\n          conversations[index].unreadCount = 0;\n          await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.CHAT_CONVERSATIONS, JSON.stringify(conversations));\n        }\n      }\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error marking messages as read:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async sendSimulatedResponse(\n    participantId: string,\n    participantName: string\n  ): Promise<void> {\n    const simulatedResponses = [\n      \"Got it! I'm about 2 miles away, heading your direction.\",\n      \"I have recovery straps and a winch. What's your exact situation?\",\n      \"On my way. Should be there in 10 minutes.\",\n      \"I can help! Do you need a pull or a tow?\",\n      \"Saw your location. I'm close by with recovery gear.\",\n      \"Hang tight, I'll be there soon with my Jeep and winch.\",\n      \"Roger that. What kind of vehicle are you driving?\",\n      \"I'm nearby. Let me grab my recovery equipment and head over.\",\n    ];\n\n    const randomResponse = simulatedResponses[Math.floor(Math.random() * simulatedResponses.length)];\n    \n    try {\n      const conversation = await this.getConversation(participantId);\n      if (!conversation) {\n        console.error(\"Conversation not found for participant:\", participantId);\n        return;\n      }\n\n      await this.sendMessage(\n        participantId,\n        participantName,\n        conversation.participantVehicle,\n        participantId,\n        participantName,\n        randomResponse\n      );\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error sending simulated response:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async getFriendsData(): Promise<Friend[]> {\n    try {\n      const data = await AsyncStorage.getItem(KEYS.FRIENDS_DATA);\n      return data ? JSON.parse(data) : [];\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error loading friends data:\", error);\n      return [];\n    }\n  },\n\n  async saveFriendsData(friends: Friend[]): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.FRIENDS_DATA, JSON.stringify(friends));\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error saving friends data:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async addFriend(friend: Friend): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      const friends = await this.getFriendsData();\n      const index = friends.findIndex((f) => f.id === friend.id);\n      if (index !== -1) {\n        friends[index] = friend;\n      } else {\n        friends.push(friend);\n      }\n      await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.FRIENDS_DATA, JSON.stringify(friends));\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error adding friend:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async removeFriend(friendId: string): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      const friends = await this.getFriendsData();\n      const filtered = friends.filter((f) => f.id !== friendId);\n      await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.FRIENDS_DATA, JSON.stringify(filtered));\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error removing friend:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async addAdventure(friendId: string, adventure: Adventure): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      const friends = await this.getFriendsData();\n      const friend = friends.find((f) => f.id === friendId);\n      if (friend) {\n        friend.adventures.unshift(adventure);\n        await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.FRIENDS_DATA, JSON.stringify(friends));\n      }\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error adding adventure:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async clearAll(): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      await AsyncStorage.multiRemove(Object.values(KEYS));\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error clearing storage:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n\n  async getFirstLaunchDone(): Promise<boolean> {\n    try {\n      const data = await AsyncStorage.getItem(KEYS.FIRST_LAUNCH);\n      return data === \"true\";\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error getting first launch status:\", error);\n      return false;\n    }\n  },\n\n  async setFirstLaunchDone(): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      await AsyncStorage.setItem(KEYS.FIRST_LAUNCH, \"true\");\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error setting first launch done:\", error);\n    }\n  },\n};\n","size_bytes":17130},"replit.md":{"content":"# Adventure Time - Offroad Recovery Assistance App\n\n## Overview\nAdventure Time is a mobile application built with Expo and React Native that helps drivers when their vehicle is stuck or broken on trails. The app provides AI-powered image analysis to demonstrate best recovery procedures, includes self-recovery guides, and enables rescue coordination with nearby offroaders.\n\n## Project Status\n✅ Fully functional mobile app with complete UI and navigation\n✅ High-contrast outdoor design system optimized for visibility and gloved hands\n✅ Offline-capable guide library for areas without cell service\n✅ All core screens implemented and working\n\n## Recent Changes (November 25, 2025)\n- **ADDED OFF-HIGHWAY GPS NAVIGATION**: New Navigate tab with trail discovery and route planning\n  - 6 popular off-highway trails with detailed info (Moab Rim, Hell's Revenge, Sand Hollow, etc.)\n  - Filter trails by difficulty (Easy/Moderate/Hard/Expert)\n  - Filter by land type (Public/Private/Mixed) with clear ownership indicators\n  - Shows distance from user location, duration, safety rating\n  - Displays trail features, vehicle requirements, and elevation gain\n  - Full trail descriptions for each route\n  - 2 pre-planned routes (Moab Adventure Loop, Scenic Beginner Route)\n  - Offline trail database with all info cached locally\n  - Compass icon in tab bar for easy access\n  - Real-time location permission with fallback handling\n\n- **ADDED REPORTING FEATURE**: Users can now report trail conditions and alert others\n  - New \"Report Condition\" button in Nearby tab header (warning icon)\n  - Modal with quick-report options:\n    - Police/Law enforcement\n    - Probation/Parole officers\n    - Deep mud conditions\n    - Water/flooding hazards\n    - Rocky terrain\n    - Snow/ice conditions\n    - Blocked trails\n    - Trail damage\n  - Reports are geo-tagged and timestamped\n  - Automatically saved to community tips\n  - Contributes to trail condition analysis for other users\n  - Successful submission shows confirmation alert\n  - User profile used to attribute reports\n\n## Previous Changes (November 21, 2025)\n- **RENAMED APP**: Changed app name from TrailGuard to Adventure Time\n  - Updated app.json display name\n  - Updated navigation header\n  - Updated weather API User-Agent\n  - Updated replit.md documentation\n  - Technical identifiers (bundle ID, storage keys) kept as trailguard for compatibility\n- Integrated react-native-maps into Nearby screen with interactive map view\n- Added user location marker, nearby offroader markers (orange), and geo-tagged community tip markers (yellow)\n- Implemented National Weather Service API integration (no API key required)\n- Added weather caching system with 30-minute expiration for offline support\n- Created trail condition analysis using real community tips\n- Added conditions card showing weather, risk level, trail hazards, and safety recommendations\n- Conditions card only displays when meaningful data exists (real weather OR recent geo-tagged tips)\n- Implemented loading/error states for weather fetching\n- Fixed ThemedText component export (changed from named to default export)\n- Installed required packages: expo-location, expo-image-picker, @react-native-async-storage/async-storage, react-native-maps\n- App successfully compiling and running (1179 modules)\n\n## Features\n\n### 1. Self-Recovery Guides (Guides Tab - Default)\n- **Category Browser**: Organized guides by situation type\n  - Stuck Vehicle (sand, mud, snow, rocks)\n  - Mechanical Issues (engine, electrical, drivetrain)\n  - Trail Navigation (GPS, trail finding, route planning)\n  - Emergency Situations (injuries, weather, communication)\n- **Search Functionality**: Quickly find specific guides\n- **Guide Details**: Step-by-step recovery procedures with:\n  - Difficulty level (Easy/Moderate/Hard)\n  - Required equipment list\n  - Safety warnings\n  - Detailed instructions\n- **Offline Access**: Guides stored locally via AsyncStorage\n\n### 2. AI-Powered Photo Analysis (AI Scan Tab)\n- **Photo Upload**: Take photos or select from gallery\n- **AI Analysis**: Get recovery recommendations based on uploaded images\n- **Visual Instructions**: See how to best approach the recovery situation\n- Uses expo-image-picker for photo selection\n\n### 3. Nearby Offroaders Map (Nearby Tab)\n- **Interactive Map**: react-native-maps with Google Maps provider\n  - User location marker (blue)\n  - Nearby offroader markers (orange) with distance labels\n  - Geo-tagged community tip markers (yellow) showing trail conditions\n  - 10-mile search radius circle\n- **Real-Time Weather**: National Weather Service API integration\n  - Temperature, conditions, and wind speed\n  - 30-minute caching for offline access\n  - Automatic fallback when API unavailable\n- **Trail Conditions Card**: Intelligent analysis of real data\n  - Only displays when weather OR recent geo-tagged tips exist\n  - Color-coded risk level (LOW/MODERATE/HIGH/CRITICAL)\n  - Weather-based risk factors\n  - Recent trail reports from community tips (up to 3 shown)\n  - Safety recommendations based on conditions\n  - Loading and error states\n  - Empty state message when no data available\n- **Trail Condition Reporting**: Alert other offroaders about hazards\n  - Report button in header for quick access\n  - 8 warning categories (police, probation, mud, water, rocks, snow, blocked, damage)\n  - Automatic location tagging\n  - Geo-tagged and timestamped reports\n  - Integrated with trail condition analysis\n- **Location Sharing**: Share your location for rescue coordination  \n- **Contact Nearby Users**: Request help from the community\n- Uses expo-location for real-time location tracking with permission handling\n\n### 4. Off-Highway GPS Navigation (Navigate Tab)\n- **Trail Discovery**: Browse off-highway trails near your location\n  - Pre-loaded database of popular trails in offroad hot spots\n  - Filter by difficulty level for your skill level\n  - Filter by land type (Public/Private) - important for legal access\n  - Distance calculations from your current location\n  - Safety ratings and popularity scores\n- **Trail Details**: Complete information for each trail\n  - Trail length, estimated duration, elevation gain\n  - Vehicle type requirements and features\n  - Terrain descriptions and hazard information\n  - Land ownership and access restrictions\n- **Route Planning**: Pre-planned multi-trail routes\n  - Adventure loops combining multiple trails\n  - Beginner-friendly scenic routes\n  - Route duration and difficulty overview\n- **Offline Capability**: All trail data cached locally for remote areas\n  - No internet required to view trail information\n  - Perfect for planning before heading out\n\n### 5. User Profile (Profile Tab)\n- **Customizable Profile**: Name, vehicle info, experience level\n- **Contact Information**: Email and phone for rescue coordination\n- **Bio/Notes**: Additional details about your vehicle or preferences\n- **Data Persistence**: Profile saved locally via AsyncStorage\n\n## Architecture\n\n### Technology Stack\n- **Framework**: Expo SDK 54 + React Native\n- **Navigation**: React Navigation 7 with bottom tabs\n- **State Management**: React hooks + AsyncStorage\n- **Styling**: StyleSheet with custom theme system\n- **Icons**: Feather icons from @expo/vector-icons\n- **Image Handling**: expo-image-picker\n- **Location Services**: expo-location with permission handling\n- **Maps**: react-native-maps (Google Maps provider)\n- **Weather Data**: National Weather Service API (no key required)\n- **Persistence**: @react-native-async-storage/async-storage\n- **Caching**: 30-minute weather cache for offline support\n\n### Project Structure\n```\n/\n├── App.tsx                      # Root component with ErrorBoundary\n├── app.json                     # Expo configuration\n├── navigation/\n│   ├── RootNavigator.tsx        # Root stack navigator\n│   ├── MainTabNavigator.tsx     # Bottom tab navigation (6 tabs)\n│   ├── GuidesStackNavigator.tsx # Guides screen stack\n│   ├── NavigateStackNavigator.tsx # Navigate/GPS trails stack\n│   └── [other stack navigators]\n├── screens/\n│   ├── GuidesScreen.tsx         # Category browser & guide listing\n│   ├── GuideDetailScreen.tsx    # Individual guide details\n│   ├── AIScanScreen.tsx         # AI photo analysis\n│   ├── NearbyScreen.tsx         # Map of nearby offroaders\n│   ├── NavigateScreen.tsx       # Off-highway GPS & trail discovery\n│   ├── ProfileScreen.tsx        # User profile management\n│   └── WelcomeScreen.tsx        # First-launch onboarding\n├── components/\n│   ├── CategoryCard.tsx         # Guide category cards\n│   ├── GuideListItem.tsx        # Individual guide item\n│   ├── ReportConditionModal.tsx # Trail condition report modal\n│   ├── ScreenScrollView.tsx     # Safe area scroll wrapper\n│   ├── ScreenKeyboardAwareScrollView.tsx\n│   ├── ThemedText.tsx           # Themed text component\n│   ├── ThemedView.tsx           # Themed view component\n│   └── ErrorBoundary.tsx        # App crash handler\n├── data/\n│   └── guides.ts                # Recovery guide database\n├── utils/\n│   ├── storage.ts               # AsyncStorage utilities\n│   ├── weather.ts               # National Weather Service API integration\n│   ├── conditions.ts            # Trail condition analysis & impact assessment\n│   ├── location.ts              # Location utilities and helpers\n│   └── trails.ts                # Off-highway trail data & filtering\n├── constants/\n│   └── theme.ts                 # Design system (colors, spacing, typography)\n├── hooks/\n│   └── useTheme.ts              # Theme context hook\n└── assets/\n    └── images/\n        ├── icon.png             # App icon\n        ├── splash.png           # Splash screen\n        └── [category images]    # Category illustrations\n```\n\n## Design System\n\n### Colors\n- **Primary**: Safety Orange (#FF6B35) - High visibility for outdoor use\n- **Background**: Dark theme optimized for outdoor glare\n- **Accent**: Bright colors for critical actions\n- **Touch Targets**: Minimum 56x56pt for gloved hands\n\n### Typography\n- **Headers**: Large, bold, high contrast\n- **Body Text**: 16pt minimum for outdoor readability\n- **Labels**: Clear hierarchy for scanning\n\n### Spacing\n- Generous padding for easy touch with gloves\n- Clear visual separation between elements\n- Consistent margins throughout\n\n## User Preferences\n- High-contrast outdoor theme for visibility in bright sunlight\n- Large touch targets (56x56pt minimum) for gloved operation\n- Offline-first approach for areas without cell service\n- Safety-focused design optimized for outdoor recovery scenarios\n\n## How to Use\n\n### For Development (Replit)\n1. The app automatically starts via the \"Start application\" workflow\n2. Scan the QR code with Expo Go app on your phone to test on device\n3. Changes hot-reload automatically - no need to restart\n\n### For Testing on Physical Device\n1. Install \"Expo Go\" app on iOS or Android\n2. Scan the QR code shown in the console\n3. App will load on your device\n4. Test all features including location and camera\n\n### For Web Testing  \n1. The web version runs on port 8081\n2. Note: Some features (camera, location) have limited web support\n3. Full functionality requires testing on mobile device via Expo Go\n\n## Data Storage\n\n### AsyncStorage Keys\n- `@trailguard/user_profile` - User profile data\n- `@trailguard/saved_guides` - Bookmarked guides\n- `@trailguard/recent_scans` - AI scan history\n- `@trailguard/weather_cache` - Cached weather data (30-minute expiration)\n- `@trailguard/community_tips` - Geo-tagged community tips\n\n### Offline Capability\n- All guides available offline\n- User profile persists locally\n- Saved guides accessible without internet\n- Weather data cached for 30 minutes (fallback when offline)\n- Community tips stored locally and geo-tagged\n\n## Future Integration Opportunities\n- **AI Vision API**: For photo analysis (OpenAI Vision, Google Gemini, etc.)\n- **Real-time Database**: For nearby user tracking and live offroader coordination (Firebase, Supabase)\n- **Push Notifications**: For community updates and rescue coordination\n- **Enhanced Weather**: Additional weather sources or radar data\n\n## Bundle Identifier\n- iOS: `com.trailguard.app`\n- Android: `com.trailguard.app`\n\n## Notes\n- Designed for outdoor use with high visibility colors\n- Optimized for gloved hands with large touch targets\n- Offline-first architecture for remote areas\n- Community-focused design for offroad recovery assistance\n","size_bytes":12679},"components/GuideListItem.tsx":{"content":"import React from \"react\";\nimport { Pressable, StyleSheet, View } from \"react-native\";\nimport { Feather } from \"@expo/vector-icons\";\nimport { useTheme } from \"@/hooks/useTheme\";\nimport ThemedText from \"@/components/ThemedText\";\nimport { Spacing, BorderRadius, Typography } from \"@/constants/theme\";\nimport { Guide } from \"@/data/guides\";\n\ninterface GuideListItemProps {\n  guide: Guide;\n  onPress: () => void;\n  isSaved?: boolean;\n}\n\nexport default function GuideListItem({ guide, onPress, isSaved }: GuideListItemProps) {\n  const { theme } = useTheme();\n\n  const difficultyColor =\n    guide.difficulty === \"Easy\"\n      ? theme.success\n      : guide.difficulty === \"Moderate\"\n      ? theme.warning\n      : theme.error;\n\n  return (\n    <Pressable\n      style={[styles.item, { backgroundColor: theme.backgroundDefault }]}\n      onPress={onPress}\n      android_ripple={{ color: theme.backgroundSecondary }}\n    >\n      <View style={styles.content}>\n        <View style={styles.header}>\n          <ThemedText style={[styles.title, Typography.h4]}>{guide.title}</ThemedText>\n          {isSaved ? (\n            <Feather name=\"bookmark\" size={20} color={theme.primary} />\n          ) : null}\n        </View>\n        <View style={styles.meta}>\n          <View style={[styles.badge, { backgroundColor: difficultyColor + \"20\" }]}>\n            <ThemedText style={[styles.badgeText, { color: difficultyColor }]}>\n              {guide.difficulty}\n            </ThemedText>\n          </View>\n          <ThemedText style={[styles.equipment, { color: theme.tabIconDefault }]}>\n            {guide.equipment.length} items needed\n          </ThemedText>\n        </View>\n      </View>\n      <Feather name=\"chevron-right\" size={24} color={theme.tabIconDefault} />\n    </Pressable>\n  );\n}\n\nconst styles = StyleSheet.create({\n  item: {\n    flexDirection: \"row\",\n    alignItems: \"center\",\n    padding: Spacing.lg,\n    borderRadius: BorderRadius.md,\n    marginBottom: Spacing.md,\n    minHeight: 80,\n  },\n  content: {\n    flex: 1,\n  },\n  header: {\n    flexDirection: \"row\",\n    alignItems: \"center\",\n    justifyContent: \"space-between\",\n    marginBottom: Spacing.sm,\n  },\n  title: {},\n  meta: {\n    flexDirection: \"row\",\n    alignItems: \"center\",\n    gap: Spacing.md,\n  },\n  badge: {\n    paddingHorizontal: Spacing.sm,\n    paddingVertical: Spacing.xs,\n    borderRadius: BorderRadius.xs,\n  },\n  badgeText: {\n    fontSize: 14,\n [participantId, currentUserId]);\n\n  const loadUserProfile = async () => {\n    const profile = await storage.getUserProfile();\n    if (profile && mountedRef.current) {\n      setCurrentUserId(profile.id);\n      setCurrentUserName(profile.name);\n    }\n  };\n\n  const loadConversation = async () => {\n    let conversation = await storage.getConversation(participantId);\n    \n    if (!conversation) {\n      conversation = await storage.createOrUpdateConversation(\n        participantId,\n        participantName,\n        participantVehicle\n      );\n    }\n    \n      <Feather name=\"message-circle\" size={48} color={theme.tabIconDefault} />\n            <ThemedText style={styles.emptyText}>No messages yet</ThemedText>\n            <ThemedText error);\n    return null;\n  }\n};\n\nexport const getCurrentUser = () => currentUser;\n\nexport const saveFriendToFirebase = async (\n  db: Database,\n  userId: string,\n  friend: Friend\n) => {\n \"firebase/database\";\nimport {\n  collection,\n  addDoc,\n  getDocs,\n  onSnapshot,\n  query as firestoreQuery,\n  where,\n  DocumentData,\n  QueryConstraint,\n  Timestamp,\n} from \"firebase/firestore\";\nimport { getFirebaseServices } from \"@/config/firebase\";\nimport type { UserProfile, NearbyOffroader, CommunityTip, GasStation, TrailWarning } from \"@/utils/storage\";\n\ninterface RealTimeListenerUnsubscribe {\n  (): void;\n}\n\n// Real-time user location tracking\nexport const publishUserLocation = async (userId: string, location: { latitude: number; longitude: number; timestamp?: number }) => {\n  try {\n    const { db } = getFirebaseServices() || {};\n    if (!db) return;\n\n    const userLocationRef = ref(db, `activeUsers/${userId}`);\n    await set(userLocationRef, {\n      ...location,\n      timestamp: location.timestamp || Date.now(),\n    });\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error publishing user location:\", error);\n  }\n};\n\n// Listen for nearby offroaders in real-time\nexport const subscribeToNearbyOffroaders = (\n  userLocation: { latitude: number; longitude: number },\n  radiusMiles: number,\n  callback: (offroaders: NearbyOffroader[]) => void\n): RealTimeListenerUnsubscribe => {\n  try {\n    const { db } = getFirebaseServices() || {};\n    if (!db) return () => {};\n\n    const activeUsersRef = ref(db, \"activeUsers\");\n\n    const unsubscribe = onValue(activeUsersRef, (snapshot) => {\n      if (!snapshot.exists()) {\n        callback([]);\n        return;\n      }\n\n      const data = snapshot.val();\n      const nearbyUsers: NearbyOffroader[] = [];\n\n      Object.entries(data).forEach(([userId, userData]: [string, any]) => {\n        if (userData.latitude && userData.longitude) {\n          const distance = calculateDistanceKm(userLocation, {\n            latitude: userData.latitude,\n            longitude: userData.longitude,\n          });\n\n          if (distance <= radiusMiles * 1.60934) {\n            // Convert miles to km\n            nearbyUsers.push({\n              id: userId,\n              name: userData.name || \"Anonymous Offroader\",\n              vehicleType: userData.vehicleType || \"Unknown\",\n              location: {\n                latitude: userData.latitude,\n                longitude: userData.longitude,\n              },\n              equipment: userData.equipment || [],\n              lastSeen: userData.timestamp || Date.now(),\n            });\n          }\n        }\n      });\n\n      nearbyUsers.sort((a, b) => a.lastSeen - b.lastSeen);\n      callback(nearbyUsers);\n    });\n\n    return unsubscribe;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error subscribing to nearby offroaders:\", error);\n    return () => {};\n  }\n};\n\n// Add community tip to shared database\nexport const addCommunityTip = async (tip: Omit<CommunityTip, \"id\">) => {\n  try {\n    const { firestore } = getFirebaseServices() || {};\n    if (!firestore) return null;\n\n    const tipsRef = collection(firestore, \"communityTips\");\n    const docRef = await addDoc(tipsRef, {\n      ...tip,\n      timestamp: tip.timestamp || Date.now(),\n    });\n\n    return {\n      ...tip,\n      id: docRef.id,\n    };\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error adding community tip:\", error);\n    return null;\n  }\n};\n\n// Listen for community tips in area\nexport const subscribeToCommunityTips = (\n  center: { latitude: number; longitude: number },\n  radiusMiles: number,\n  callback: (tips: CommunityTip[]) => void\n): RealTimeListenerUnsubscribe => {\n  try {\n    const { firestore } = getFirebaseServices() || {};\n    if (!firestore) return () => {};\n\n    const tipsRef = collection(firestore, \"communityTips\");\n\n    const unsubscribe = onSnapshot(tipsRef, (snapshot) => {\n      const tips: CommunityTip[] = [];\n\n      snapshot.forEach((doc) => {\n        const data = doc.data();\n\n        if (data.location?.latitude && data.location?.longitude) {\n          const distance = calculateDistanceKm(center, {\n            latitude: data.location.latitude,\n            longitude: data.location.longitude,\n          });\n\n          if (distance <= radiusMiles * 1.60934) {\n            tips.push({\n              id: doc.id,\n              title: data.title,\n              description: data.description,\n              category: data.category,\n              timestamp: data.timestamp,\n              location: data.location,\n              author: data.author,\n              helpful: data.helpful || 0,\n            });\n          }\n        }\n      });\n\n      tips.sort((a, b) => b.timestamp - a.timestamp);\n      callback(tips);\n    });\n\n    return unsubscribe;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error subscribing to community tips:\", error);\n    return () => {};\n  }\n};\n\n// Publish gas station prices (for admin/service)\nexport const publishGasStationPrice = async (stationId: string, stationData: {\n  name: string;\n  location: { latitude: number; longitude: number };\n  pricePerGallon: number;\n  fuelType: \"regular\" | \"diesel\" | \"both\";\n  lastUpdated: number;\n}) => {\n  try {\n    const { db } = getFirebaseServices() || {};\n    if (!db) return;\n\n    const stationRef = ref(db, `gasStations/${stationId}`);\n    await set(stationRef, stationData);\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error publishing gas station price:\", error);\n  }\n};\n\n// Get real-time gas station prices\nexport const subscribeToGasStations = (\n  userLocation: { latitude: number; longitude: number },\n  radiusMiles: number,\n  callback: (stations: GasStation[]) => void\n): RealTimeListenerUnsubscribe => {\n  try {\n    const { db } = getFirebaseServices() || {};\n    if (!db) return () => {};\n\n    const stationsRef = ref(db, \"gasStations\");\n\n    const unsubscribe = onValue(stationsRef, (snapshot) => {\n      if (!snapshot.exists()) {\n        callback([]);\n        return;\n      }\n\n      const data = snapshot.val();\n      const nearbyStations: GasStation[] = [];\n\n      Object.entries(data).forEach(([stationId, stationData]: [string, any]) => {\n        if (stationData.location?.latitude && stationData.location?.longitude) {\n          const distance = calculateDistanceKm(userLocation, {\n            latitude: stationData.location.latitude,\n            longitude: stationData.location.longitude,\n          });\n\n          if (distance <= radiusMiles * 1.60934) {\n            nearbyStations.push({\n              id: stationId,\n              name: stationData.name,\n              location: stationData.location,\n              pricePerGallon: stationData.pricePerGallon,\n              fuelType: stationData.fuelType,\n              distance: distance / 1.60934, // Convert back to miles\n              isOpen: true, // Assume open if in database\n            });\n          }\n        }\n      });\n\n      nearbyStations.sort((a, b) => a.distance - b.distance);\n      callback(nearbyStations.slice(0, 6));\n    });\n\n    return unsubscribe;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error subscribing to gas stations:\", error);\n    return () => {};\n  }\n};\n\n// Publish trail warning\nexport const publishTrailWarning = async (\n  userId: string,\n  userName: string,\n  warning: Omit<TrailWarning, \"id\" | \"userId\" | \"userName\">\n) => {\n  try {\n    const { firestore } = getFirebaseServices() || {};\n    if (!firestore) return;\n\n    const warningRef = collection(firestore, \"trailWarnings\");\n    await addDoc(warningRef, {\n      ...warning,\n      userId,\n      userName,\n      timestamp: Date.now(),\n    });\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error publishing trail warning:\", error);\n  }\n};\n\n// Subscribe to trail warnings in real-time\nexport const subscribeToTrailWarnings = (\n  userLocation: { latitude: number; longitude: number },\n  radiusMiles: number,\n  callback: (warnings: TrailWarning[]) => void\n): RealTimeListenerUnsubscribe => {\n  try {\n    const { firestore } = getFirebaseServices() || {};\n    if (!firestore) return () => {};\n\n    const warningsRef = collection(firestore, \"trailWarnings\");\n    const q = firestoreQuery(\n      warningsRef,\n      where(\"expiresAt\", \">\", Date.now())\n    );\n\n    const unsubscribe = onSnapshot(q, (snapshot) => {\n      const warnings: TrailWarning[] = [];\n\n      snapshot.forEach((doc) => {\n        const data = doc.data() as any;\n        const distance = calculateDistanceKm(userLocation, {\n          latitude: data.location.latitude,\n          longitude: data.location.longitude,\n        });\n\n        if (distance <= radiusMiles * 1.60934) {\n          warnings.push({\n            id: doc.id,\n            type: data.type,\n            location: data.location,\n            timestamp: data.timestamp,\n            userId: data.userId,\n            userName: data.userName,\n            severity: data.severity,\n            description: data.description,\n            expiresAt: data.expiresAt,\n          });\n        }\n      });\n\n      warnings.sort((a, b) => b.timestamp - a.timestamp);\n      callback(warnings);\n    });\n\n    return unsubscribe;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error subscribing to trail warnings:\", error);\n    return () => {};\n  }\n};\n\n// Helper function to calculate distance between two coordinates\nfunction calculateDistanceKm(\n  coords1: { latitude: number; longitude: number },\n  coords2: { latitude: number; longitude: number }\n): number {\n  const R = 6371; // Earth's radius in km\n  const dLat = toRad(coords2.latitude - coords1.latitude);\n  const dLon = toRad(coords2.longitude - coords1.longitude);\n  const lat1 = toRad(coords1.latitude);\n  const lat2 = toRad(coords2.latitude);\n\n  const a =\n    Math.sin(dLat / 2) * Math.sin(dLat / 2) +\n    Math.sin(dLon / 2) * Math.sin(dLon / 2) * Math.cos(lat1) * Math.cos(lat2);\n  const c = 2 * Math.atan2(Math.sqrt(a), Math.sqrt(1 - a));\n  return R * c;\n}\n\nfunction toRad(deg: number): number {\n  return deg * (Math.PI / 180);\n}\n","size_bytes":9750},"config/firebase.ts":{"content":"import { initializeApp } from \"firebase/app\";\nimport { getAuth } from \"firebase/auth\";\nimport { getDatabase } from \"firebase/database\";\nimport { getFirestore } from \"firebase/firestore\";\n\n// Replace these with your Firebase project credentials\n// Get these from Firebase Console: https://console.firebase.google.com\nconst firebaseConfig = {\n  apiKey: process.env.EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_API_KEY || \"\",\n  authDomain: process.env.EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_AUTH_DOMAIN || \"\",\n  databaseURL: process.env.EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_DATABASE_URL || \"\",\n  projectId: process.env.EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID || \"\",\n  storageBucket: process.env.EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_STORAGE_BUCKET || \"\",\n  messagingSenderId: process.env.EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_MESSAGING_SENDER_ID || \"\",\n  appId: process.env.EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_APP_ID || \"\",\n};\n\nlet app: ReturnType<typeof initializeApp> | null = null;\nlet auth: ReturnType<typeof getAuth> | null = null;\nlet db: ReturnType<typeof getDatabase> | null = null;\nlet firestore: ReturnType<typeof getFirestore> | null = null;\n\nexport const initializeFirebase = async () => {\n  try {\n    if (!firebaseConfig.projectId) {\n      console.warn(\"Firebase config not set up. Using local storage mode.\");\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    app = initializeApp(firebaseConfig);\n    auth = getAuth(app);\n    db = getDatabase(app);\n    firestore = getFirestore(app);\n\n    return { auth, db, firestore };\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Firebase initialization error:\", error);\n    return null;\n  }\n};\n\nexport const getFirebaseServices = () => {\n  return { auth, db, firestore };\n};\n\nexport default {\n  initializeFirebase,\n  getFirebaseServices,\n};\n","size_bytes":1648},"screens/FriendsScreen.tsx":{"content":"import React, { useState, useEffect } from \"react\";\nimport {\n  View,\n  StyleSheet,\n  FlatList,\n  Pressable,\n  Alert,\n  Platform,\n} from \"react-native\";\nimport { Feather } from \"@expo/vector-icons\";\nimport { \"@/utils/storage\";\nimport { Spacing, Typography, BorderRadius } from \"@/constants/theme\";\nimport { getFirebaseServices } from \"@/config/firebase\";\nimport { subscribeToFriends, latitude: number;\n    longitude: number;\n  };\n  lastSeen: number;\n  adventures: Adventure[];\n}\n\ninterface Adventure {\n  id: string;\n  title: string;\n  location: string;\n  timestamp: number;\n  difficulty: \"Easy\" | \"Moderate\" | \"Hard\";\n}\n\nexport default function FriendsScreen() {\n  const { theme, isDark } = useTheme();\n  const [friends, setFriends] =    };\n  }, []);\n\n  const loadFriendsData = async () => {\n    const { db } = getFirebaseServices();\n    if (db) {\n      const userId = \"demo_user_\" + Date.now();\n      const unsub = subscribeToFriends(db, userId, (friendsData) => {\n        setFriends(friendsData);\n      });\n      setUnsubscribe(() => unsub);\n      setUseFirebase(true);\n    } else {\n      const friendsData = For now, using local storage.\",\n        [{ text: \"OK\" }]\n      );\n    }\n    const sampleFriends: Friend[] = [\n      {\n        id: \"friend_1\",\n        name: \"Alex Mountain\",\n         {\n            id: \"adv_4\",\n            title: \"Rock crawling adventure\",\n            location: \"Stone Valley\",\n            timestamp: Date.now() - 45 * 60 * 1000,\n storage.saveFriendsData(sampleFriends);\n      setFriends(sampleFriends);\n    }\n  };\n\n  const getDifficultyColor = (difficulty: string) => {\n    switch (difficulty) {\n      case \"Easy\":\n        return theme.success;\n      case \"Moderate\":\n        return theme.warning;\n      case \"Hard\":\n        return theme.error;\n      default:\n        return theme.primary;\n    }\n  };\n\n  const getStatusIcon = (status: string) => {\n    switch (status) {\n      case \"mobile\":\n        return { icon: \"check-circle\", color: theme.success };\n      case \"recovering\":\n        return { icon: \"refresh-cw\", color: theme.warning };\n      case \"stuck\":\n        return { icon: \"alert-circle\", color: theme.error };\n      default:\n        return { icon: \"info\", color: theme.primary };\n    }\n  };\n\n  const formatTime = (timestamp: number) => {\n    const diff = Date.now() - timestamp;\n    const minutes = Math.floor(diff / 60000);\n    const hours = Math.floor(diff / 3600000);\n    const days = Math.floor(diff / 86400000);\n\n    if (minutes < 1) return \"Just now\";\n    if (minutes < 60) return `${minutes}m ago`;\n    if (hours < 24) return `${hours}h ago`;\n    return `${days}d ago`;\n  };\n\n  const StatusUpdateCard = ({ update }: { update: StatusUpdate }) => {\n    const { icon, color } = getStatusIcon(update.status);\n    return (\n {update.userName}\n          </ThemedText>\n          <ThemedText\n            style={[\n              Typography.small,\n              {\n                color: theme.tabIconDefault,\n            <StatusUpdateCard key={update.id} update={update} />\n          ))}\n        </View>\n      )}\n\n      {authUser && (\n        <View style={[styles.userCard, { backgroundColor: <Feather name=\"user\" size={32} color={theme.primary} />\n            </View>\n          )}\n          <View style={styles.userInfo}>\n            <ThemedText style={[Typography.h4, { marginBottom: {authUser.email}\n            </ThemedText>\n          </View>\n          <Pressable\n            onPress={async () => {\n              await logout();\n              setAuthUser(null);\n           Sign in with social media to connect with friends\n            </ThemedText>\n            \n            <Pressable\n              onPress={async () => {\n       const user = await facebookSignIn();\n                setIsLoggingIn(false);\n                if (user) {\n                  Alert.alert(\"Success\", `Signed in as ${user.displayName}`);\n                  loadFriendsData();\n                } else {\n                  Alert.alert(\"Error\", \"Failed to sign in with Facebook\");\n                }\n              }}\n              disabled={isLoggingIn}\n              style={[\n                styles.socialButton,\n                { backgroundColor: \"#1877F2\", marginTop: Spacing.md },\n              ]}\n            >\n              <Feather name=\"facebook\" size={20} color=\"#fff\" style={{ marginRight: Spacing.sm }} />\n              <ThemedText style={[Typography.button, { color: \"#fff\" }]}>\n                Facebook\n              </ThemedText>\n            </Pressable>\n\n            <Pressable\n              onPress={addSampleFriends}\n              style={[\n                styles.addFriendsButton,\n                { backgroundColor: theme.primary, marginTop: Spacing.lg },\n              ]}\n            >\n              <ThemedText style={[Typography.button, { color: \"#fff\" }]}>\n                Add Demo Friends\n              </ThemedText>\n            </Pressable>\n          </View>\n        </View>\n      ) : (\n        <FlatList\n          scrollEnabled={false}\n          data={friends}\n          keyExtractor={(item) => item.id}\n          renderItem={({ item }) => <FriendCard friend={item} />}\n          contentContainerStyle={{ gap: Spacing.lg }}\n        />\n      )}\n    </ScreenScrollView>\n  );\n}\n\nconst styles = StyleSheet.create({\n  updatesSection: {\n    marginBottom: Spacing.xl,\n  },\n  sectionTitle: {\n    marginBottom: Spacing.md,\n    marginTop: Spacing.lg,\n  },\n  updateCard: {\n    flexDirection: \"row\",\n    padding: Spacing.md,\n    borderRadius: BorderRadius.md,\n    marginBottom: Spacing.md,\n    alignItems: \"center\",\n  },\n  updateIcon: {\n    width: 40,\n    height: 40,\n    borderRadius: BorderRadius.full,\n    alignItems: \"center\",\n    justifyContent: \"center\",\n    marginRight: Spacing.md,\n  },\n  updateContent: {\n    flex: 1,\n  },\n  header: {\n    flexDirection: \"row\",\n    justifyContent: \"space-between\",\n    alignItems: \"flex-start\",\n    marginBottom: Spacing.xl,\n    gap: Spacing.md,\n  },\n right: Spacing.lg,\n    width: 56,\n    height: 56,\n    borderRadius: BorderRadius.full,\n    justifyContent: \"center\",\n    alignItems: \"center\",\n    elevation: 5,\n    shadowColor: \"#000\",\n    shadowOffset: { width: 0, height: 2 },\n    shadowOpacity: 0.25,\n    shadowRadius: 3.84,\n  },\n  friendCard: {\n    borderRadius: BorderRadius.lg,\n    padding: Spacing.lg,\n    marginHorizontal: Spacing.lg,\n  },\n  friendHeader: {\n    flexDirection: \"row\",\n    justifyContent: \"space-between\",\n    alignItems: \"flex-start\",\n  },\n  friendInfo: {\n    flex: 1,\n  },\n  statusBadge: {\n    flexDirection: \"row\",\n    gap: Spacing.xs,\n    paddingHorizontal: Spacing.sm,\n    paddingVertical: Spacing.xs,\n    borderRadius: BorderRadius.sm,\n    alignItems: \"center\",\n  },\n  adventureItem: {\n    flexDirection: \"row\",\n    justifyContent: \"space-between\",\n    alignItems: \"center\",\n    padding: Spacing.md,\n    borderRadius: BorderRadius.md,\n    marginBottom:
