marginLeft: Spacing.md,\n  },\n  emptyState: {\n    alignItems: \"center\",\n    justifyContent: \"center\",\n    paddingVertical: Spacing[\"4xl\"],\n    paddingHorizontal: Spacing.lg,\n  },\n  addFriendsButton: {\n    marginTop: Spacing.xl,\n    paddingHorizontal: Spacing.lg,\n    paddingVertical: Spacing.md,\n    borderRadius: BorderRadius.lg,\n  },\n  socialLoginSection: {\n    width: \"100%\",\n  },\n  socialButton: {\n    flexDirection: \"row\",\n    paddingVertical: Spacing.lg,\n    borderRadius: BorderRadius.md,\n    alignItems: \"center\",\n    justifyContent: \"center\",\n  },\n  userCard: {\n    flexDirection: \"row\",\n    padding: Spacing.lg,\n    borderRadius: BorderRadius.md,\n    alignItems: \"center\",\n    marginBottom: Spacing.xl,\n    gap: Spacing.md,\n  },\n  userAvatar: {\n    width: 48,\n    height: 48,\n    borderRadius: BorderRadius.full,\n    alignItems: \"center\",\n    justifyContent: \"center\",\n    backgroundColor: \"rgba(0,0,0,0.1)\",\n  },\n  userInfo: {\n    flex: 1,\n  },\n  logoutButton: {\n    padding: Spacing.sm,\n    borderRadius: BorderRadius.md,\n  },\n});\n","size_bytes":19700},"utils/trailNavigation.ts":{"content":"import { LocationObject } from \"expo-location\";\nimport { CommunityTip, storage, SavedRoute } from \"./storage\";\nimport { calculateDistance } from \"./location\";\nimport firebaseService from \"@/config/firebase\";\n\nexport type RouteType = \"safest\" | \"scenic\" | \"shortest\" | \"popular\";\nexport interface Waypoint {\n  latitude: number;\n  longitude: number;\n  label?: string;\n  difficulty?: \"easy\" | \"moderate\" | \"hard\";\n}\n\nexport interface NavigationRoute {\n  id: string;\n  type: RouteType;\n  waypoints: Waypoint[];\n  distance: number;\n  difficulty: \"easy\" | \"moderate\" | \"hard\";\n  rating: number;\n  userCount: number;\n  estTime: number;\n  description: string;\n  hazardCount?: number;\n  waypointCount?: number;\n  isCommunity?: boolean;\n  userId?: string;\n  timestamp?: number;\n}\n\nconst WAYPOINT_RADIUS = 0.5; // miles\n\nexport const calculateRouteDistance = (waypoints: Waypoint[]): number => {\n  let total = 0;\n  for (let i = 0; i < waypoints.length - 1; i++) {\n    total += calculateDistance(waypoints[i], waypoints[i + 1]);\n  }\n  return total;\n};\n\nexport const calculateEstimatedTime = (\n  distance: number,\n  difficulty: \"easy\" | \"moderate\" | \"hard\"\n): number => {\n  const avgSpeed = difficulty === \"easy\" ? 20 : difficulty === \"moderate\" ? 15 : 10;\n  return Math.ceil(distance / avgSpeed * 60); // minutes\n};\n\nexport const generateRoutes = async (\n  start: LocationObject,\n  destination: LocationObject,\n  communityTips: CommunityTip[],\n  warnings: any[] = []\n): Promise<NavigationRoute[]> => {\n  const routes: NavigationRoute[] = [];\n\n  // Filter tips and warnings within route corridor\n  const routeTips = communityTips.filter((tip) => {\n    if (!tip.location) return false;\n    const distToStart = calculateDistance(start.coords, tip.location);\n    const distToDest = calculateDistance(tip.location, destination.coords);\n    const directDist = calculateDistance(start.coords, destination.coords);\n    // Include tips if they're reasonably close to the direct route\n    return distToStart + distToDest <= directDist * 1.5;\n  });\n\n  // Collect waypoints from tips\n  const safetyWaypoints: Waypoint[] = [];\n  const scenicWaypoints: Waypoint[] = [];\n  const popularWaypoints: Waypoint[] = [];\n\n  for (const tip of routeTips) {\n    if (!tip.location) continue;\n    const waypoint: Waypoint = {\n      latitude: tip.location.latitude,\n      longitude: tip.location.longitude,\n      label: tip.title,\n      difficulty: (tip.difficulty as any) || \"moderate\",\n    };\n\n    // Categorize by type\n    if (tip.category === \"safety\" || tip.category === \"route\") {\n      safetyWaypoints.push(waypoint);\n    }\n    if (tip.category === \"scenic\" || tip.category === \"viewpoint\") {\n      scenicWaypoints.push(waypoint);\n    }\n    if ((tip.rating || 0) > 4) {\n      popularWaypoints.push(waypoint);\n    }\n  }\n\n  // Route 1: Safest (avoids warnings, prioritizes safety tips)\n  const safeRoute = buildRoute(\n    start.coords,\n    destination.coords,\n    safetyWaypoints,\n    warnings,\n    \"safest\"\n  );\n  routes.push(safeRoute);\n\n  // Route 2: Scenic (includes scenic waypoints)\n  const scenicRoute = buildRoute(\n    start.coords,\n    destination.coords,\n    scenicWaypoints,\n    warnings,\n    \"scenic\"\n  );\n  routes.push(scenicRoute);\n\n  // Route 3: Shortest (direct with minimal waypoints)\n  const shortRoute = buildRoute(\n    start.coords,\n    destination.coords,\n    [],\n    warnings,\n    \"shortest\"\n  );\n  routes.push(shortRoute);\n\n  // Route 4: Most Popular (highly rated waypoints)\n  const popularRoute = buildRoute(\n    start.coords,\n    destination.coords,\n    popularWaypoints,\n    warnings,\n    \"popular\"\n  );\n  routes.push(popularRoute);\n\n  return routes;\n};\n\nconst buildRoute = (\n  start: any,\n  destination: any,\n  waypoints: Waypoint[],\n  warnings: any[],\n  type: RouteType\n): NavigationRoute => {\n  // Sort waypoints to create optimal path\n  let sortedWaypoints = [...waypoints];\n\n  // Simple sorting: by distance from current position\n  sortedWaypoints.sort((a, b) => {\n    const distA = calculateDistance(start, a);\n    const distB = calculateDistance(start, b);\n    return distA - distB;\n  });\n\n  // Build final waypoint array\n  const fullWaypoints: Waypoint[] = [start, ...sortedWaypoints, destination];\n\n  const distance = calculateRouteDistance(fullWaypoints);\n  const avgDifficulty =\n    waypoints.length > 0\n      ? waypoints.reduce(\n          (sum, wp) => sum + (wp.difficulty === \"hard\" ? 3 : wp.difficulty === \"moderate\" ? 2 : 1),\n          0\n        ) / waypoints.length\n      : 1;\n\n  const difficulty =\n    avgDifficulty > 2.3\n      ? \"hard\"\n      : avgDifficulty > 1.5\n        ? \"moderate\"\n        : \"easy\";\n\n  const estTime = calculateEstimatedTime(distance, difficulty);\n\n  // Default ratings based on type\n  const defaultRating = type === \"scenic\" ? 4.5 : 4.0;\n  const defaultUserCount = Math.floor(Math.random() * 50) + 5;\n\n  return {\n    id: `route_${type}_${Date.now()}`,\n    type,\n    waypoints: fullWaypoints,\n    distance,\n    difficulty,\n    rating: defaultRating,\n    userCount: defaultUserCount,\n    estTime,\n    description: getRouteDescription(type, distance, difficulty),\n    isCommunity: true,\n  };\n};\n\nconst getRouteDescription = (\n  type: RouteType,\n  distance: number,\n  difficulty: string\n): string => {\n  const descriptions: Record<RouteType, string> = {\n    safest: `Avoids hazards. ${distance.toFixed(1)} mi • ${difficulty}`,\n    scenic: `Beautiful views. ${distance.toFixed(1)} mi • ${difficulty}`,\n    shortest: `Direct route. ${distance.toFixed(1)} mi • ${difficulty}`,\n    popular: `Community favorite. ${distance.toFixed(1)} mi • ${difficulty}`,\n  };\n  return descriptions[type];\n};\n\nexport const publishRoute = async (\n  route: NavigationRoute,\n  userId: string\n): Promise<void> => {\n  try {\n    // Cache locally\n    const savedRoutes = await storage.getSavedRoutes();\n    const routeToSave: SavedRoute = {\n      id: route.id,\n      type: route.type,\n      waypoints: route.waypoints,\n      distance: route.distance,\n      difficulty: route.difficulty,\n      rating: route.rating,\n      userCount: route.userCount,\n      estTime: route.estTime,\n      description: route.description,\n      timestamp: Date.now(),\n    };\n    savedRoutes.push(routeToSave);\n    await storage.saveSavedRoutes(savedRoutes);\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error publishing route:\", error);\n    throw error;\n  }\n};\n\nexport const subscribeToRoutes = async (\n  userId: string,\n  callback: (routes: NavigationRoute[]) => void\n): Promise<() => void> => {\n  try {\n    // Fallback to local storage\n    const savedRoutes = await storage.getSavedRoutes();\n    const routes: NavigationRoute[] = savedRoutes.map((r) => ({\n      ...r,\n      isCommunity: true,\n    }));\n    callback(routes);\n\n    // Return unsubscribe function (simplified)\n    return () => {};\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error fetching routes:\", error);\n    callback([]);\n    return () => {};\n  }\n};\n\nexport const rateRoute = async (\n  routeId: string,\n  rating: number,\n  userId: string\n): Promise<void> => {\n  try {\n    // Update local cache\n    const savedRoutes = await storage.getSavedRoutes();\n    const idx = savedRoutes.findIndex((r) => r.id === routeId);\n    if (idx >= 0) {\n      savedRoutes[idx].rating = rating;\n      await storage.saveSavedRoutes(savedRoutes);\n    }\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error rating route:\", error);\n  }\n};\n","size_bytes":7350},"utils/gasStationAPI.ts":{"content":"// Integration with gas station price APIs\n// Currently supports RapidAPI GAS API for live pricing\n\nconst GAS_API_BASE = \"https://gas-api.p.rapidapi.com/prices\";\nconst GAS_API_RAPID_KEY = process.env.EXPO_PUBLIC_GAS_API_KEY || \"\";\nconst GAS_API_HOST = \"gas-api.p.rapidapi.com\";\n\nexport interface GasPriceData {\n  brand: string;\n  name: string;\n  latitude: number;\n  longitude: number;\n  diesel?: number;\n  mid?: number;\n  premium?: number;\n  regular: number;\n}\n\n/**\n * Fetch live gas prices from nearby gas stations\n * Requires EXPO_PUBLIC_GAS_API_KEY environment variable\n */\nexport const fetchGasPrices = async (\n  latitude: number,\n  longitude: number,\n  radiusMiles: number = 10\n): Promise<GasPriceData[]> => {\n  try {\n    if (!GAS_API_RAPID_KEY) {\n      console.warn(\"GAS_API_KEY not configured, using fallback prices\");\n      return [];\n    }\n\n    const response = await fetch(\n      `${GAS_API_BASE}?latitude=${latitude}&longitude=${longitude}&radius=${radiusMiles}`,\n      {\n        method: \"GET\",\n        headers: {\n          \"x-rapidapi-key\": GAS_API_RAPID_KEY,\n          \"x-rapidapi-host\": GAS_API_HOST,\n        },\n      }\n    );\n\n    if (!response.ok) {\n      console.error(\"Gas API error:\", response.status);\n      return [];\n    }\n\n    const data = await response.json();\n\n    // API returns array of stations with price data\n    if (Array.isArray(data)) {\n      return data;\n    }\n\n    if (data.prices && Array.isArray(data.prices)) {\n      return data.prices;\n    }\n\n    return [];\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error fetching gas prices:\", error);\n    return [];\n  }\n};\n\n/**\n * Format gas price data to match our GasStation interface\n */\nexport const formatGasPriceData = (priceData: GasPriceData) => {\n  const avgPrice = priceData.regular || priceData.mid || 0;\n\n  // Determine fuel type availability\n  let fuelType: \"regular\" | \"diesel\" | \"both\" = \"regular\";\n  if (priceData.diesel && priceData.regular) {\n    fuelType = \"both\";\n  } else if (priceData.diesel) {\n    fuelType = \"diesel\";\n  }\n\n  return {\n    name: priceData.name || priceData.brand || \"Gas Station\",\n    location: {\n      latitude: priceData.latitude,\n      longitude: priceData.longitude,\n    },\n    pricePerGallon: avgPrice,\n    fuelType,\n    isOpen: true, // API doesn't provide open status\n  };\n};\n\n/**\n * Calculate average gas price from multiple stations\n */\nexport const calculateAveragePrice = (stations: GasPriceData[]): number => {\n  if (stations.length === 0) return 0;\n\n  const total = stations.reduce((sum, station) => sum + (station.regular || 0), 0);\n  return Math.round((total / stations.length) * 100) / 100;\n};\n","size_bytes":2622},"PATENTABLE_FEATURES.md":{"content":"# Adventure Time - Patentable Features & Technical Innovations\n\n**App Name:** Adventure Time (formerly TrailGuard)  \n**Creator:** Sinjin Gallegos  \n**Date:** November 22, 2025  \n**Purpose:** Documentation of unique technical innovations for provisional patent application\n\n---\n\n## 1. AI-Powered Photo Analysis for Off-Road Recovery\n\n### Problem Solved\nDrivers stuck on trails need immediate, visual guidance on recovery procedures without cell service or expert access.\n\n### Technical Innovation\n- **Local Pattern Matching Algorithm**: Image analysis that provides recoverability percentages (0-100%) based on vehicle position, terrain type, and environmental factors\n- **Real-time Visual Instruction Generation**: System that analyzes uploaded photos and generates step-by-step recovery procedures specific to the detected situation\n- **Offline AI Capability**: Machine learning models that run locally on device without requiring cloud API calls, enabling functionality in remote areas without cell service\n\n### Key Features\n- Accepts photos from camera or gallery\n- Analyzes terrain, vehicle position, and recovery challenges\n- Outputs detailed recovery steps with difficulty ratings\n- Provides equipment recommendations based on situation analysis\n- Stores analysis history for reference\n\n---\n\n## 2. Offline-First Trail Recovery Knowledge System\n\n### Problem Solved\nExisting recovery guides require internet access; drivers need immediate access to critical recovery procedures in remote areas with no signal.\n\n### Technical Innovation\n- **Local-First Database Architecture**: Complete recovery guide library stored locally via AsyncStorage, eliminating dependency on cloud databases\n- **Categorized Recovery Procedures**: Organized guide system with 4 major categories:\n  - Stuck Vehicle (sand, mud, snow, rocks)\n  - Mechanical Issues (engine, electrical, drivetrain)\n  - Trail Navigation (GPS, trail finding, route planning)\n  - Emergency Situations (injuries, weather, communication)\n- **Search & Index System**: Offline search functionality allowing users to find guides by situation type, equipment needs, or difficulty level\n- **Persistent Storage with Sync**: Local storage that syncs with cloud when connectivity returns\n\n### Key Features\n- 50+ recovery guides with step-by-step instructions\n- Difficulty levels (Easy/Moderate/Hard)\n- Equipment requirement lists\n- Safety warnings per procedure\n- Searchable by situation type or keywords\n\n---\n\n## 3. Real-Time Weather & Trail Condition Analysis System\n\n### Problem Solved\nOff-roaders need real-time understanding of trail conditions and weather impacts on recovery difficulty before attempting rescue.\n\n### Technical Innovation\n- **Intelligent Condition Assessment**: System that analyzes real weather data plus community-contributed tips to determine trail risk levels (LOW/MODERATE/HIGH/CRITICAL)\n- **Weather Caching for Offline Support**: 30-minute weather cache allowing condition assessment in areas with intermittent connectivity\n- **Location-Aware Risk Analysis**: Analyzes weather impact on specific recovery strategies (e.g., how rain affects winch effectiveness, how temperature affects tire pressure)\n- **Community Data Integration**: Incorporates user-submitted trail condition reports (geo-tagged) to supplement official weather data\n\n### Key Features\n- National Weather Service API integration (no key required)\n- Risk level color-coding\n- Weather-based recovery recommendations\n- Recent trail reports from community (up to 3 shown)\n- Wind speed, temperature, and condition analysis\n- Fallback to cached data when offline\n\n---\n\n## 4. Interactive Map with Real-Time Offroader Coordination\n\n### Problem Solved\nStranded drivers need to quickly locate and coordinate with nearby experienced off-roaders for assistance and resource sharing.\n\n### Technical Innovation\n- **Multi-Layer Interactive Mapping**: Real-time map featuring:\n  - User's current location (blue marker with accuracy circle)\n  - Nearby offroaders (orange markers with distance labels)\n  - Community trail condition reports (yellow geo-tagged markers)\n  - 10-mile search radius visualization\n- **Location-Based Rescue Coordination**: System for identifying qualified helpers within geographic range with specific equipment\n- **Real-Time Status Broadcasting**: Ability to share location and status with nearby community members for group coordination\n- **Equipment Matching Algorithm**: Identifies nearby offroaders whose equipment matches recovery needs\n\n### Key Features\n- React Native Maps with Google Maps provider\n- Real-time location tracking with permission handling\n- Distance calculations and display\n- Equipment-based helper identification\n- Geo-tagged community tip markers\n- Request help from nearby users with single tap\n\n---\n\n## 5. Friends & Adventure Tracking System\n\n### Problem Solved\nOff-road groups need coordinated real-time status updates and adventure tracking for safety and social coordination.\n\n### Technical Innovation\n- **Adventure Log with Real-Time Status**: Track group adventures with live status updates\n- **Friend Network & Communication**: Built-in messaging and status updates for coordinated group recovery\n- **Adventure History with Timestamps**: Complete record of past adventures, locations, difficulty ratings\n- **Real-Time Presence Indicators**: See where friends are and their status in real-time\n\n### Key Features\n- Add friends and track their status\n- Create adventure logs with location and difficulty\n- Real-time chat with nearby offroaders\n- Status updates (safe/in-trouble/recovering)\n- Adventure history and statistics\n\n---\n\n## 6. Profile with Equipment Inventory Management\n\n### Problem Solved\nRecovery teams need to know each member's available equipment and vehicle specs before coordinating multi-vehicle recovery.\n\n### Technical Innovation\n- **Equipment Capability Registry**: Detailed inventory system tracking 8+ recovery equipment types\n- **Vehicle Specification Database**: Complete vehicle specs (make, model, year, modifications) affecting recovery options\n- **Custom Avatar Upload**: User profile customization with photo upload capability\n- **Experience Level Tracking**: User experience levels (novice/intermediate/expert) affecting recommendation severity\n\n### Key Features\n- Display name and vehicle information\n- 8+ equipment types with toggle tracking (winch, tow straps, recovery boards, hi-lift jack, shovel, tire repair, air compressor, jumper cables)\n- Vehicle specs: make, model, year, modifications\n- Custom photo avatar upload\n- Emergency contact information\n- Local data persistence\n\n---\n\n## 7. Community Contribution & Tip System\n\n### Problem Solved\nRecovery knowledge varies by region and season; traditional guides don't capture local, real-time wisdom from active off-roaders.\n\n### Technical Innovation\n- **Geo-Tagged Tip System**: Community members contribute location-specific recovery tips that map to exact coordinates\n- **Category-Based Knowledge Management**: Tips organized by category (recovery, navigation, trail condition, maintenance, safety)\n- **Temporal Filtering**: Tips weighted by recency, showing most recent information from actual trail users\n- **Helpful Rating System**: Community members rate tip usefulness, improving algorithm accuracy\n\n### Key Features\n- Submit recovery tips with location\n- Tips include title, description, category\n- Geo-tagging shows exact location on map\n- Author vehicle type and experience visible\n- Helpful rating system\n- Search by category or location\n\n---\n\n## 8. Custom Photo Avatar System\n\n### Problem Solved\nUsers want personalized profiles with custom images rather than preset avatars for better community recognition.\n\n### Technical Innovation\n- **Photo Library Integration**: Direct integration with device photo library via Expo Image Picker\n- **Circular Avatar Processing**: Image editing with 1:1 aspect ratio constraint and circular display\n- **Local URI Storage**: Photo URIs stored locally in AsyncStorage for persistence across sessions\n- **Quality Optimization**: Automatic image quality adjustment (0.8) for storage efficiency\n\n### Key Features\n- Upload custom photo from gallery\n- Edit with 1:1 aspect ratio\n- Display in circular frame\n- Change or remove custom photo\n- Fallback to preset avatars if needed\n\n---\n\n## Summary of Unique Innovations\n\n| Innovation | Unique Aspect | Patent Potential |\n|-----------|---------------|-----------------|\n| AI Photo Analysis | Local ML for recovery assessment | HIGH |\n| Offline Guide Library | Complete recovery database stored locally | HIGH |\n| Weather + Condition Analysis | Intelligent risk assessment combining weather + community data | HIGH |\n| Multi-Layer Interactive Map | Real-time offroader + condition coordination | HIGH |\n| Friends & Real-Time Status | Coordinated group recovery tracking | MEDIUM |\n| Equipment Inventory | Recovery capability registry system | MEDIUM |\n| Community Geo-Tagged Tips | Location-based knowledge crowdsourcing | MEDIUM |\n| Custom Avatar Upload | Personalized profile system | LOW |\n\n---\n\n## Technical Stack (Supporting Documentation)\n\n- **Frontend Framework**: Expo SDK 54 + React Native\n- **Offline Storage**: AsyncStorage for all local data persistence\n- **External APIs**: National Weather Service API (no authentication required)\n- **Maps**: React Native Maps with Google Maps provider\n- **Image Handling**: Expo Image Picker for photo selection\n- **Location Services**: Expo Location for real-time GPS tracking\n\n---\n\n## Business Model & Market Impact\n\n**Target Market**: Off-road enthusiasts, adventure travel groups, professional recovery services\n\n**Unique Value**: Only app combining AI-powered photo analysis, offline functionality, real-time coordination, and community knowledge for off-road recovery\n\n**Competitive Advantage**: \n- Works without cell service (critical in remote areas)\n- AI learns from images to provide recovery guidance\n- Community-powered trail intelligence\n- Real-time friend/offroader coordination\n\n---\n\n## Next Steps for Patent Filing\n\n1. **File Provisional Patent Application (PPA)** with USPTO\n   - Cost: ~$320 for small entities\n   - Timeline: 12 months of provisional 1.0 with custom photo feature  \n**Status**: Active Development\n\n","size_bytes":10623},"utils/socialAuth.ts":{"content":"import {\n  GoogleAuthProvider,\n  FacebookAuthProvider,\n  signInWithCredential,\n  signOut,\n  onAuthStateChanged,\n  User,\n} from \"firebase/auth\";\nimport { getFirebaseServices } from \"@/config/firebase\";\nimport { Alert } from \"react-native\";\n\nlet Google: any = null;\nlet Facebook: any = null;\n\n// Try to load auth providers if available\ntry {\n  Google = require(\"expo-auth-session/providers/google\");\n} catch (e) {\n  console.warn(\"Google auth provider not available\");\n}\n\ntry {\n  Facebook = require(\"expo-auth-session/providers/facebook\");\n} catch (e) {\n  console.warn(\"Facebook auth provider not available\");\n}\n\nexport const googleSignIn = async () => {\n  try {\n    if (!Google) {\n      Alert.alert(\"Auth Not Available\", \"Google Sign-In is not configured yet\");\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    const request = await Google.useAuthRequest({\n      clientId: process.env.EXPO_PUBLIC_GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID || \"\",\n      redirectUrl: Google.useAuthRequestResult?.url || \"\",\n    });\n\n    if (!request?.promptAsync) {\n      console.error(\"Google Auth request not available\");\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    const result = await request.promptAsync();\n\n    if (result.type === \"success\" && result.authentication?.accessToken) {\n      const { auth } = getFirebaseServices();\n      if (!auth) {\n        console.error(\"Firebase auth not initialized\");\n        return null;\n      }\n\n      const credential = GoogleAuthProvider.credential(\n        null,\n        result.authentication.accessToken\n      );\n      const userCredential = await signInWithCredential(auth, credential);\n      return userCredential.user;\n    }\n\n    return null;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Google sign-in error:\", error);\n    Alert.alert(\"Error\", \"Failed to sign in with Google\");\n    return null;\n  }\n};\n\nexport const facebookSignIn = async () => {\n  try {\n    if (!Facebook) {\n      Alert.alert(\"Auth Not Available\", \"Facebook Sign-In is not configured yet\");\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    const request = await Facebook.useAuthRequest({\n      clientId: process.env.EXPO_PUBLIC_FACEBOOK_APP_ID || \"\",\n      redirectUrl: Facebook.useAuthRequestResult?.url || \"\",\n    });\n\n    if (!request?.promptAsync) {\n      console.error(\"Facebook Auth request not available\");\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    const result = await request.promptAsync();\n\n    if (result.type === \"success\" && result.authentication?.accessToken) {\n      const { auth } = getFirebaseServices();\n      if (!auth) {\n        console.error(\"Firebase auth not initialized\");\n        return null;\n      }\n\n      const credential = FacebookAuthProvider.credential(\n        result.authentication.accessToken\n      );\n      const userCredential = await signInWithCredential(auth, credential);\n      return userCredential.user;\n    }\n\n    return null;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Facebook sign-in error:\", error);\n    return null;\n  }\n};\n\nexport const logout = async () => {\n  try {\n    const { auth } = getFirebaseServices();\n    if (auth) {\n      await signOut(auth);\n      return true;\n    }\n    return false;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Sign-out error:\", error);\n    return false;\n  }\n};\n\nexport const subscribeToAuthState = (\n  callback: (user: User | null) => void\n) => {\n  const { auth } = getFirebaseServices();\n  if (!auth) {\n    callback(null);\n    return () => {};\n  }\n\n  return onAuthStateChanged(auth, (user) => {\n    callback(user);\n  });\n};\n\nexport interface SocialUser {\n  id: string;\n  name: string;\n  email: string;\n  photoURL: string | null;\n  provider: \"google\" | \"facebook\";\n}\n\nexport const getCurrentUser = (): SocialUser | null => {\n  const { auth } = getFirebaseServices();\n  const user = auth?.currentUser;\n\n  if (!user) return null;\n\n  return {\n    id: user.uid,\n    name: user.displayName || \"User\",\n    email: user.email || \"\",\n    photoURL: user.photoURL,\n    provider: (user.providerData[0]?.providerId || \"google\").includes(\"google\")\n      ? \"google\"\n      : \"facebook\",\n  };\n};\n","size_bytes":3952},"utils/realtimeSync.ts":{"content":"// Real-time synchronization manager for Adventure Time\n// Manages Firebase subscriptions and data sync\n\nimport { getFirebaseServices } from \"@/config/firebase\";\nimport {\n  publishUserLocation,\n  subscribeToNearbyOffroaders,\n  subscribeToGasStations,\n  subscribeToCommunityTips,\n  addCommunityTip,\n} from \"@/utils/firebaseService\";\nimport type { UserProfile, NearbyOffroader, CommunityTip, GasStation } from \"@/utils/storage\";\n\ninterface SyncSubscriptions {\n  nearbyOffroaders?: () => void;\n  gasStations?: () => void;\n  communityTips?: () => void;\n  locationInterval?: NodeJS.Timeout;\n}\n\nclass RealtimeSync {\n  private subscriptions: SyncSubscriptions = {};\n  private userId: string = \"\";\n  private isEnabled = false;\n\n  /**\n   * Initialize real-time sync with user ID\n   */\n  initialize(userId: string) {\n    this.userId = userId;\n    const { db, firestore } = getFirebaseServices() || {};\n    this.isEnabled = !!(db && firestore);\n\n    if (!this.isEnabled) {\n      console.warn(\"Firebase not configured, real-time sync disabled\");\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Start publishing user location periodically\n   */\n  startLocationSharing(location: { latitude: number; longitude: number }, intervalMs = 10000) {\n    if (!this.isEnabled || !this.userId) return;\n\n    // Publish immediately\n    publishUserLocation(this.userId, {\n      ...location,\n      name: \"Adventure Time User\",\n      vehicleType: \"4x4\",\n    } as any);\n\n    // Set up periodic updates\n    this.subscriptions.locationInterval = setInterval(() => {\n      publishUserLocation(this.userId, {\n        ...location,\n        name: \"Adventure Time User\",\n        vehicleType: \"4x4\",\n      } as any);\n    }, intervalMs);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Stop publishing location\n   */\n  stopLocationSharing() {\n    if (this.subscriptions.locationInterval) {\n      clearInterval(this.subscriptions.locationInterval);\n      delete this.subscriptions.locationInterval;\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Subscribe to nearby offroaders\n   */\n  subscribeNearby(\n    userLocation: { latitude: number; longitude: number },\n    radiusMiles: number,\n    callback: (offroaders: NearbyOffroader[]) => void\n  ) {\n    if (!this.isEnabled) return;\n\n    // Unsubscribe from old subscription\n    if (this.subscriptions.nearbyOffroaders) {\n      this.subscriptions.nearbyOffroaders();\n    }\n\n    // Subscribe to new data\n    this.subscriptions.nearbyOffroaders = subscribeToNearbyOffroaders(\n      userLocation,\n      radiusMiles,\n      callback\n    );\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Subscribe to gas stations\n   */\n  subscribeGasStations(\n    userLocation: { latitude: number; longitude: number },\n    radiusMiles: number,\n    callback: (stations: GasStation[]) => void\n  ) {\n    if (!this.isEnabled) return;\n\n    // Unsubscribe from old subscription\n    if (this.subscriptions.gasStations) {\n      this.subscriptions.gasStations();\n    }\n\n    // Subscribe to new data\n    this.subscriptions.gasStations = subscribeToGasStations(\n      userLocation,\n      radiusMiles,\n      callback\n    );\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Subscribe to community tips\n   */\n  subscribeCommunityTips(\n    center: { latitude: number; longitude: number },\n    radiusMiles: number,\n    callback: (tips: CommunityTip[]) => void\n  ) {\n    if (!this.isEnabled) return;\n\n    // Unsubscribe from old subscription\n    if (this.subscriptions.communityTips) {\n      this.subscriptions.communityTips();\n    }\n\n    // Subscribe to new data\n    this.subscriptions.communityTips = subscribeToCommunityTips(\n      center,\n      radiusMiles,\n      callback\n    );\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Publish a community tip\n   */\n  async publishTip(tip: Omit<CommunityTip, \"id\">) {\n    if (!this.isEnabled) return null;\n    return await addCommunityTip(tip);\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Unsubscribe from all\n   */\n  unsubscribeAll() {\n    if (this.subscriptions.nearbyOffroaders) {\n      this.subscriptions.nearbyOffroaders();\n    }\n    if (this.subscriptions.gasStations) {\n      this.subscriptions.gasStations();\n    }\n    if (this.subscriptions.communityTips) {\n      this.subscriptions.communityTips();\n    }\n    this.stopLocationSharing();\n    this.subscriptions = {};\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Check if sync is enabled\n   */\n  isRealtimeSyncAvailable() {\n    return this.isEnabled;\n  }\n}\n\n// Export singleton instance\nexport const realtimeSync = new RealtimeSync();\n","size_bytes":4268},"utils/weather.ts":{"content":"import AsyncStorage from \"@react-native-async-storage/async-storage\";\nimport { WeatherCondition } from \"./conditions\";\n\nconst CACHE_DURATION_MS = 30 * 60 * 1000;\nconst CACHE_KEY_PREFIX = \"@trailguard/weather_cache\";\n\ninterface CachedWeather {\n  data: WeatherCondition;\n  timestamp: number;\n}\n\nexport async function fetchWeatherFromNWS(\n  latitude: number,\n  longitude: number\n): Promise<WeatherCondition | null> {\n  try {\n    const pointsUrl = `https://api.weather.gov/points/${latitude.toFixed(4)},${longitude.toFixed(4)}`;\n    \n    const pointsResponse = await fetch(pointsUrl, {\n      headers: {\n        \"User-Agent\": \"(Adventure Time Offroad App, contact@adventuretime.app)\",\n      },\n    });\n\n    if (!pointsResponse.ok) {\n      console.error(\"NWS points API error:\", pointsResponse.status);\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    const pointsData = await pointsResponse.json();\n    const forecastUrl = pointsData.properties?.forecast;\n\n    if (!forecastUrl) {\n      console.error(\"No forecast URL in NWS response\");\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    const forecastResponse = await fetch(forecastUrl, {\n      headers: {\n        \"User-Agent\": \"(Adventure Time Offroad App, contact@adventuretime.app)\",\n      },\n    });\n\n    if (!forecastResponse.ok) {\n      console.error(\"NWS forecast API error:\", forecastResponse.status);\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    const forecastData = await forecastResponse.json();\n    const currentPeriod = forecastData.properties?.periods?.[0];\n\n    if (!currentPeriod) {\n      console.error(\"No forecast periods in NWS response\");\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    const windSpeedValue = parseWindSpeed(currentPeriod.windSpeed);\n\n    const weatherCondition: WeatherCondition = {\n      condition: currentPeriod.shortForecast || \"Unknown\",\n      temperature: currentPeriod.temperature || 0,\n      windSpeed: windSpeedValue,\n      description: currentPeriod.detailedForecast || currentPeriod.shortForecast || \"No description available\",\n    };\n\n    return weatherCondition;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error fetching weather from NWS:\", error);\n    return null;\n  }\n}\n\nexport async function getWeather(\n  latitude: number,\n  longitude: number\n): Promise<WeatherCondition | null> {\n  const cacheKey = `${CACHE_KEY_PREFIX}_${latitude.toFixed(4)}_${longitude.toFixed(4)}`;\n\n  try {\n    const cachedData = await AsyncStorage.getItem(cacheKey);\n    \n    if (cachedData) {\n      const cached: CachedWeather = JSON.parse(cachedData);\n      const age = Date.now() - cached.timestamp;\n\n      if (age < CACHE_DURATION_MS) {\n        console.log(\"Returning cached weather data\");\n        return cached.data;\n      }\n    }\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error reading weather cache:\", error);\n  }\n\n  const freshWeather = await fetchWeatherFromNWS(latitude, longitude);\n\n  if (freshWeather) {\n    try {\n      const cacheData: CachedWeather = {\n        data: freshWeather,\n        timestamp: Date.now(),\n      };\n      await AsyncStorage.setItem(cacheKey, JSON.stringify(cacheData));\n      console.log(\"Weather data cached successfully\");\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(\"Error caching weather data:\", error);\n    }\n    return freshWeather;\n  }\n\n  try {\n    const cachedData = await AsyncStorage.getItem(cacheKey);\n    if (cachedData) {\n      const cached: CachedWeather = JSON.parse(cachedData);\n      console.log(\"API failed, returning stale cached weather data\");\n      return cached.data;\n    }\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error reading stale cache:\", error);\n  }\n\n  return null;\n}\n\nexport async function clearWeatherCache(): Promise<void> {\n  try {\n    const keys = await AsyncStorage.getAllKeys();\n    const weatherCacheKeys = keys.filter((key) => key.startsWith(CACHE_KEY_PREFIX));\n    \n    if (weatherCacheKeys.length > 0) {\n      await AsyncStorage.multiRemove(weatherCacheKeys);\n      console.log(`Cleared ${weatherCacheKeys.length} weather cache entries`);\n    }\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error clearing weather cache:\", error);\n  }\n}\n\nfunction parseWindSpeed(windSpeedString: string): number {\n  if (!windSpeedString) {\n    return 0;\n  }\n\n  const match = windSpeedString.match(/(\\d+)/);\n  if (match) {\n    return parseInt(match[1], 10);\n  }\n\n  return 0;\n}\n","size_bytes":4218},"utils/conditions.ts":{"content":"import { CommunityTip } from \"./storage\";\nimport { calculateDistance } from \"./location\";\n\nexport interface WeatherCondition {\n  condition: string;\n  temperature: number;\n  windSpeed: number;\n  description: string;\n}\n\nexport interface TrailConditionSummary {\n  recentTips: CommunityTip[];\n  severity: \"low\" | \"moderate\" | \"high\" | \"severe\";\n  primaryConcerns: string[];\n  affectedAreas: number;\n}\n\nexport interface ImpactAssessment {\n  overallSeverity: \"low\" | \"moderate\" | \"high\" | \"critical\";\n  riskFactors: string[];\n  recommendations: string[];\n  color: string;\n}\n\nexport function filterNearbyTips(\n  tips: CommunityTip[],\n  userLocation: { latitude: number; longitude: number },\n  radiusMiles: number\n): CommunityTip[] {\n  const tipsWithLocation = tips.filter((tip) => tip.location !== undefined);\n\n  const tipsWithDistance = tipsWithLocation.map((tip) => ({\n    tip,\n    distance: calculateDistance(userLocation, tip.location!),\n  }));\n\n  const nearbyTips = tipsWithDistance.filter(\n    (item) => item.distance <= radiusMiles\n  );\n\n  nearbyTips.sort((a, b) => a.distance - b.distance);\n\n  return nearbyTips.map((item) => item.tip);\n}\n\nexport function analyzeTrailConditions(\n  tips: CommunityTip[],\n  userLocation: { latitude: number; longitude: number },\n  radiusMiles: number\n): TrailConditionSummary {\n  const nearbyTips = filterNearbyTips(tips, userLocation, radiusMiles);\n\n  const trailConditionTips = nearbyTips.filter(\n    (tip) => tip.category === \"trail_condition\"\n  );\n\n  const sevenDaysAgo = Date.now() - 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000;\n  const recentTips = trailConditionTips.filter(\n    (tip) => tip.timestamp > sevenDaysAgo\n  );\n\n  let severity: \"low\" | \"moderate\" | \"high\" | \"severe\";\n  const tipCount = recentTips.length;\n\n  if (tipCount === 0) {\n    severity = \"low\";\n  } else if (tipCount <= 2) {\n    severity = \"moderate\";\n  } else if (tipCount <= 4) {\n    severity = \"high\";\n  } else {\n    severity = \"severe\";\n  }\n\n  const concernKeywords = [\n    \"mud\",\n    \"snow\",\n    \"washout\",\n    \"flooded\",\n    \"stuck\",\n    \"ice\",\n    \"slippery\",\n    \"blocked\",\n    \"impassable\",\n    \"damage\",\n    \"hazard\",\n    \"dangerous\",\n  ];\n\n  const primaryConcerns: string[] = [];\n  recentTips.forEach((tip) => {\n    const text = `${tip.title} ${tip.description}`.toLowerCase();\n    concernKeywords.forEach((keyword) => {\n      if (text.includes(keyword) && !primaryConcerns.includes(keyword)) {\n        primaryConcerns.push(keyword);\n      }\n    });\n  });\n\n  const uniqueLocations = new Set<string>();\n  recentTips.forEach((tip) => {\n    if (tip.location) {\n      const locationKey = `${tip.location.latitude.toFixed(3)},${tip.location.longitude.toFixed(3)}`;\n      uniqueLocations.add(locationKey);\n    }\n  });\n\n  const affectedAreas = uniqueLocations.size;\n\n  return {\n    recentTips,\n    severity,\n    primaryConcerns,\n    affectedAreas,\n  };\n}\n\nexport function calculateImpactAssessment(\n  weather: WeatherCondition | null,\n  trailConditions: TrailConditionSummary\n): ImpactAssessment {\n  const riskFactors: string[] = [];\n\n  if (weather) {\n    const condition = weather.condition.toLowerCase();\n    const description = weather.description.toLowerCase();\n\n    if (condition.includes(\"rain\") || description.includes(\"rain\")) {\n      riskFactors.push(\"Rain increases mud and slippery conditions\");\n    }\n    if (condition.includes(\"snow\") || description.includes(\"snow\")) {\n      riskFactors.push(\"Snow creates ice and visibility hazards\");\n    }\n    if (condition.includes(\"storm\") || description.includes(\"storm\")) {\n      riskFactors.push(\"Severe weather conditions present\");\n    }\n    if (weather.windSpeed > 25) {\n      riskFactors.push(\"High winds may affect vehicle stability\");\n    }\n    if (weather.temperature < 32) {\n      riskFactors.push(\"Freezing temperatures create ice hazards\");\n    }\n  }\n\n  trailConditions.primaryConcerns.forEach((concern) => {\n    riskFactors.push(`Trail reports indicate ${concern} conditions`);\n  });\n\n  if (trailConditions.affectedAreas > 0) {\n    riskFactors.push(\n      `${trailConditions.affectedAreas} area${trailConditions.affectedAreas > 1 ? \"s\" : \"\"} with reported issues`\n    );\n  }\n\n  let weatherSeverity: \"low\" | \"moderate\" | \"high\" | \"critical\" = \"low\";\n  if (weather) {\n    const condition = weather.condition.toLowerCase();\n    const description = weather.description.toLowerCase();\n\n    if (\n      condition.includes(\"severe\") ||\n      condition.includes(\"storm\") ||\n      description.includes(\"severe\")\n    ) {\n      weatherSeverity = \"critical\";\n    } else if (\n      condition.includes(\"rain\") ||\n      condition.includes(\"snow\") ||\n      weather.windSpeed > 25\n    ) {\n      weatherSeverity = \"high\";\n    } else if (weather.temperature < 32 || weather.windSpeed > 15) {\n      weatherSeverity = \"moderate\";\n    }\n  }\n\n  const trailSeverityMap = {\n    low: 0,\n    moderate: 1,\n    high: 2,\n    severe: 3,\n  };\n\n  const weatherSeverityMap = {\n    low: 0,\n    moderate: 1,\n    high: 2,\n    critical: 3,\n  };\n\n  const trailSeverityValue = trailSeverityMap[trailConditions.severity];\n  const weatherSeverityValue = weatherSeverityMap[weatherSeverity];\n\n  let overallSeverity: \"low\" | \"moderate\" | \"high\" | \"critical\";\n  const maxSeverity = Math.max(trailSeverityValue, weatherSeverityValue);\n\n  if (maxSeverity === 0) {\n    overallSeverity = \"low\";\n  } else if (maxSeverity === 1) {\n    overallSeverity = \"moderate\";\n  } else if (maxSeverity === 2) {\n    overallSeverity = \"high\";\n  } else {\n    overallSeverity = \"critical\";\n  }\n\n  let recommendations: string[];\n  switch (overallSeverity) {\n    case \"low\":\n      recommendations = [\"Stay alert\", \"Basic recovery gear recommended\"];\n      break;\n    case \"moderate\":\n      recommendations = [\"Carry recovery gear\", \"Check tire pressure\"];\n      break;\n    case \"high\":\n      recommendations = [\n        \"Travel in groups\",\n        \"Advanced recovery equipment required\",\n      ];\n      break;\n    case \"critical\":\n      recommendations = [\n        \"Consider delaying trip\",\n        \"Expert recovery skills needed\",\n      ];\n      break;\n  }\n\n  let color: string;\n  switch (overallSeverity) {\n    case \"low\":\n      color = \"#2E7D32\";\n      break;\n    case \"moderate\":\n      color = \"#FBC02D\";\n      break;\n    case \"high\":\n      color = \"#FF6B35\";\n      break;\n    case \"critical\":\n      color = \"#D32F2F\";\n      break;\n  }\n\n  return {\n    overallSeverity,\n    riskFactors,\n    recommendations,\n    color,\n  };\n}\n","size_bytes":6418},"screens/SplashScreen.tsx":{"content":"import React, { useEffect } from \"react\";\nimport { View, StyleSheet, ScrollView, Pressable } from \"react-native\";\nimport { \"fallen_tree\" | \"flood\" | \"law_enforcement\" | \"parole_officer\";\n\nexport interface WarningOption {\n  type: WarningType;\n  label: string;\n  icon: string;\n  color: string;\n  description: string;\n}\n\nexport interface TrailWarning {\n  id: string;\n  type: WarningType;\n  location: {\n    latitude: number;\n    longitude: number;\n  };\n  timestamp: number;\n  userId: string;\n  userName: string;\n  severity: \"low\" | \"medium\" | \"high\";\n  description?: string;\n  expiresAt: number;\n}\n\nexport const WARNING_OPTIONS: WarningOption[] = [\n  {\n    type: \"rocks\",\n    label: \"Big Rocks\",\n    icon: \"alert-circle\",\n    color: \"#FF9800\",\n    description: \"Large rocks blocking the trail\",\n  },\n  {\n    type: \"fallen_tree\",\n    label: \"Fallen Tree\",\n checkpoint\",\n  },\n];\n\nexport const WARNING_DURATION_MS = 4 * 60 * 60 * 1000; // 4 hours\n\nexport const getWarningOption = (type: WarningType): WarningOption | undefined => {\n  return \"fallen_tree\":\n      return \"medium\";\n    case \"flood\":\n      return \"high\";\n    case \"law_enforcement\":\n    case \"parole_officer\":\n      return \"high\";\n    default:\n      return Go to https://console.firebase.google.com\n2. Click \"Create a project\"\n3. Name it \"Adventure Time\"\n4. Accept the defaults and create\n\n### Step 2: Enable Realtime Database\n1. In Firebase Console, go to \"Build\" → \"Realtime Database\"\n2. Click \"Create Database\"\n3. Choose location (closest to you)\n4. Start in **Test mode** (for development)\n5. Copy the Database URL (looks like: `https://your-project.firebaseio.com`)\n\n### Step 3: Enable Authentication\n1. Go to \"Build\" → \"Authentication\"\n2. Click \"Get Started\"\n3. Click \"Anonymous\" provider\n4. Enable it and Save\n\n### Step 4: Get Your Credentials\n1. Go to Project Settings (gear icon)\n2. Click \"General\" tab\n3. Scroll down to see your Firebase SDK config\n4. Copy these values:\n   - API Key → `EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_API_KEY`\n   - Auth Domain → `EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_AUTH_DOMAIN`\n   - Project ID → `EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID`\n   - Storage Bucket → `EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_STORAGE_BUCKET`\n   - Messaging Sender ID → `EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_MESSAGING_SENDER_ID`\n   - App ID → `EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_APP_ID`\n5. Database URL (from Step 2) → `EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_DATABASE_URL`\n\n### Step 5: Add to Your App\n1. Create a `.env` file in your project root\n2. Copy values from `.env.example`\n3. Paste your Firebase credentials\n4. Save the file\n\n### Step 6: Restart Your App\n- The app will automatically detect and use Firebase\n- Friends will now sync in real-time!\n\n## What Now Works\n\n✅ **Real-time Friends** - Add friends and see them instantly  \n✅ **Live Locations** - Friends' locations update in real-time  \n✅ **Adventures** - Share recovery adventures with your friends  \n✅ **Free Forever** - Uses Firebase free tier (1 GB storage)  \n✅ **Automatic Sync** - Changes sync instantly across all users  \n\n## Database Structure\n\n```\nusers/\n  {userId}/\n    friends/\n      {friendId}/\n        - name\n        - vehicleType\n        - location: {latitude, longitude}\n        - lastSeen\n        - adventures/\n          {adventureId}/\n            - title\n            - location\n            - difficulty\n            - timestamp\n```\n\n## Important Notes\n\n- Friends are stored per user ID (unique per app installation)\n- All data is public in test mode (for development)\n- Set security rules in Firebase Console for production\n- Free tier includes 100 concurrent connections\n- Perfect for testing with friends!\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\n**\"Firebase Not Configured\" message?**\n- Check your `.env` file has all values\n- Make sure keys start with `EXPO_PUBLIC_`\n- Restart the app\n\n**Friends not syncing?**\n- Check Firebase Console to see data structure\n- Verify Realtime Database is enabled\n- Check browser console for errors\n\n**Need help?**\n- Firebase Docs: https://firebase.google.com/docs\n- Realtime Database: https://firebase.google.com/docs/database\n- Authentication: https://firebase.google.com/docs/auth\n","size_bytes":2964},"src/server/webhookHandlers.ts":{"content":"import { getStripeSync } from './stripeClient';\n\nexport class WebhookHandlers {\n  static async processWebhook(payload: Buffer, signature: string, uuid: string): Promise<void> {\n    if (!Buffer.isBuffer(payload)) {\n      throw new Error(\n        'STRIPE WEBHOOK ERROR: Payload must be a Buffer. ' +\n        'Received type: ' + typeof payload + '. ' +\n        'This usually means express.json() parsed the body before reaching this handler. ' +\n        'FIX: Ensure webhook route is registered BEFORE app.use(express.json()).'\n      );\n    }\n\n    const sync = await getStripeSync();\n    await sync.processWebhook(payload, signature, uuid);\n  }\n}\n","size_bytes":644},"seed-products.js":{"content":"const Stripe = require('stripe');\nconst fetch = require('node-fetch');\n\n// Fetch Stripe credentials from Replit connection API\nasync function getStripeSecretKey() {\n  const hostname = process.env.REPLIT_CONNECTORS_HOSTNAME;\n  const xReplitToken = process.env.REPL_IDENTITY\n    ? 'repl ' + process.env.REPL_IDENTITY\n    : process.env.WEB_REPL_RENEWAL\n      ? 'depl ' + process.env.WEB_REPL_RENEWAL\n      : null;\n\n  if (!xReplitToken) {\n    throw new Error('REPL_IDENTITY or WEB_REPL_RENEWAL not found');\n  }\n\n  const url = new URL(`https://${hostname}/api/v2/connection`);\n  url.searchParams.set('include_secrets', 'true');\n  url.searchParams.set('connector_names', 'stripe');\n  url.searchParams.set('environment', 'development');\n\n  const response = await fetch(url.toString(), {\n    headers: {\n      'Accept': 'application/json',\n      'X_REPLIT_TOKEN': xReplitToken\n    }\n  });\n\n  const data = await response.json();\n  const connectionSettings = data.items?.[0];\n\n  if (!connectionSettings || !connectionSettings.settings.secret) {\n    throw new Error('Stripe development connection not found');\n  }\n\n  return connectionSettings.settings.secret;\n}\n\nasync function createAdventureTimeProducts() {\n  try {\n    const secretKey = await getStripeSecretKey();\n    const stripe = new Stripe(secretKey, {\n      apiVersion: '2025-11-17.clover',\n    });\n\n    console.log('Creating Adventure Time products in Stripe...');\n\n    // Pro Plan - One-time purchase\n    const proProduct = await stripe.products.create({\n      name: 'Pro Offroader',\n      description: 'Unlock all premium recovery features and advanced AI analysis',\n      metadata: {\n        category: 'pro_plan',\n        featured: 'true',\n        features: 'Advanced AI Analysis, Offline Maps, Premium Guides, Priority Support'\n      },\n    });\n\n    const proPrice = await stripe.prices.create({\n      product: proProduct.id,\n      unit_amount: 4999,\n      currency: 'usd',\n      metadata: {\n        type: 'one_time',\n        description: 'Lifetime access to all Pro features'\n      },\n    });\n\n    console.log('✅ Pro Offroader: $49.99 (one-time)', proProduct.id, proPrice.id);\n\n    // Premium Monthly - Subscription\n    const premiumMonthlyProduct = await stripe.products.create({\n      name: 'Premium Monthly',\n      description: 'Monthly subscription with all Pro features and monthly updates',\n      metadata: {\n        category: 'subscription',\n        featured: 'false',\n        features: 'All Pro Features, Monthly Trail Updates, Expert Support'\n      },\n    });\n\n    const premiumMonthlyPrice = await stripe.prices.create({\n      product: premiumMonthlyProduct.id,\n      unit_amount: 999,\n      currency: 'usd',\n      recurring: { interval: 'month' },\n      metadata: {\n        type: 'subscription',\n        interval: 'monthly'\n      },\n    });\n\n    console.log('✅ Premium Monthly: $9.99/month', premiumMonthlyProduct.id, premiumMonthlyPrice.id);\n\n    // Premium Yearly - 'repl ' + process.env.REPL_IDENTITY\n    : process.env.WEB_REPL_RENEWAL\n      ? 'depl ' + process.env.WEB_REPL_RENEWAL\n      : null;\n\n  if (!xReplitToken) {\n    throw new Error('X_REPLIT_TOKEN not found for repl/depl');\n  }\n\n  const connectorName = 'stripe';\n  const isProduction = process.env.REPLIT_DEPLOYMENT === '1';\n  const targetEnvironment = isProduction ? 'production' : 'development';\n\n  const url = new URL(`https://${hostname}/api/v2/connection`);\n  url.searchParams.set('include_secrets', 'true');\n  url.searchParams.set('connector_names', connectorName);\n  url.searchParams.set('environment', targetEnvironment);\n\n  const response = await fetch(url.toString(), {\n    headers: {\n      'Accept': 'application/json',\n      'X_REPLIT_TOKEN': xReplitToken\n    }\n  });\n\n  const data = await response.json();\n  connectionSettings = data.items?.[0];\n\n  if (!connectionSettings || (!connectionSettings.settings.publishable || !connectionSettings.settings.secret)) {\n    throw new Error(`Stripe ${targetEnvironment} connection not found`);\n  }\n\n  return {\n    publishableKey: connectionSettings.settings.publishable,\n    secretKey: connectionSettings.settings.secret,\n  };\n}\n\nexport async function getUncachableStripeClient() {\n  const { secretKey } = await getCredentials();\n\n  return new Stripe(secretKey, {\n    apiVersion: \"2025-11-17.clover\",\n  });\n}\n\nexport async function getStripePublishableKey() {\n  const { publishableKey } = await getCredentials();\n  return publishableKey;\n}\n\nexport async function getStripeSecretKey() {\n  const { secretKey } = await getCredentials();\n  return secretKey;\n}\n\nlet stripeSync: any = null;\n\nexport async function getStripeSync() {\n  if (!stripeSync) {\n    const { StripeSync } = await import('stripe-replit-sync');\n    const secretKey = await getStripeSecretKey();\n\n    stripeSync = new StripeSync({\n      poolConfig: {\n        connectionString: process.env.DATABASE_URL!,\n        max: 2,\n      },\n      stripeSecretKey: secretKey,\n    });\n  }\n  return stripeSync;\n}\n","size_bytes":2218},"utils/routeNavigation.ts":{"content":"import { LocationObject } from \"expo-location\";\nimport { CommunityTip, storage, SavedRoute, TrailWarning } from \"./storage\";\nimport { calculateDistance } from \"./location\";\n\nexport type RouteType = \"safest\" | \"scenic\" | \"shortest\" | \"popular\";\n\nexport interface Waypoint {\n  latitude: number;\n  longitude: number;\n  label?: string;\n  difficulty?: \"easy\" | \"moderate\" | \"hard\";\n  description?: string;\n  poiType?: \"safety_tip\" | \"scenic_view\" | \"rest_stop\" | \"fuel_stop\";\n}\n\nexport interface RouteSegment {\n  startWaypoint: Waypoint;\n  endWaypoint: Waypoint;\n  distance: number;\n  difficulty: \"easy\" | \"moderate\" | \"hard\";\n  warnings: TrailWarning[];\n  hazardCount: number;\n  instructionText: string;\n}\n\nexport interface RouteStatistics {\n  totalDistance: number;\n  totalTime: number;\n  avgDifficulty: \"easy\" | \"moderate\" | \"hard\";\n  easySegmentCount: number;\n  moderateSegmentCount: number;\n  hardSegmentCount: number;\n  totalWaypoints: number;\n  hazardsOnRoute: number;\n  fuelsStopsAvailable: number;\n  scenicViewpoints: number;\n  safetyTips: number;\n}\n\nexport interface EnhancedNavigationRoute {\n  id: string;\n  type: RouteType;\n  waypoints: Waypoint[];\n  segments: RouteSegment[];\n  distance: number;\n  difficulty: \"easy\" | \"moderate\" | \"hard\";\n  rating: number;\n  userCount: number;\n  estTime: number;\n  description: string;\n  statistics: RouteStatistics;\n  isFavorited?: boolean;\n  isCommunity?: boolean;\n  userId?: string;\n  timestamp?: number;\n}\n\nexport const calculateSegmentDistance = (start: Waypoint, end: Waypoint): number => {\n  return calculateDistance(start, end);\n};\n\nexport const getDirectionInstruction = (\n  fromWaypoint: Waypoint,\n  toWaypoint: Waypoint,\n  segmentIndex: number\n): string => {\n  const distance = calculateSegmentDistance(fromWaypoint, toWaypoint);\n  const difficulty = toWaypoint.difficulty || \"moderate\";\n\n  const instructions: Record<string, string[]> = {\n    easy: [\n      `Head to ${toWaypoint.label} (${distance.toFixed(1)} mi) - Easy terrain`,\n      `Continue forward ${distance.toFixed(1)} miles to ${toWaypoint.label}`,\n      `Proceed on easy trail toward ${toWaypoint.label}`,\n    ],\n    moderate: [\n      `Navigate ${distance.toFixed(1)} mi to ${toWaypoint.label} - Moderate difficulty`,\n      `Proceed carefully for ${distance.toFixed(1)} miles to ${toWaypoint.label}`,\n      `Follow trail ${distance.toFixed(1)} mi to ${toWaypoint.label} - Some technical sections`,\n    ],\n    hard: [\n      `Prepare for challenging terrain to ${toWaypoint.label} (${distance.toFixed(1)} mi)`,\n      `Difficult section ahead: ${distance.toFixed(1)} mi to ${toWaypoint.label}`,\n      `Navigate technical terrain ${distance.toFixed(1)} mi to ${toWaypoint.label}`,\n    ],\n  };\n\n  const instructionArray = instructions[difficulty];\n  return instructionArray[segmentIndex % instructionArray.length];\n};\n\nexport const buildRouteSegments = (\n  waypoints: Waypoint[],\n  warnings: TrailWarning[]\n): RouteSegment[] => {\n  const segments: RouteSegment[] = [];\n\n  for (let i = 0; i < waypoints.length - 1; i++) {\n    const startWp = waypoints[i];\n    const endWp = waypoints[i + 1];\n    const distance = calculateSegmentDistance(startWp, endWp);\n\n    // Check for warnings on this segment\n    const segmentWarnings = warnings.filter((w) => {\n      const distToStart = calculateDistance(startWp, w.location);\n      const distToEnd = calculateDistance(endWp, w.location);\n      return distToStart + distToEnd <= distance * 1.3;\n    });\n\n    segments.push({\n      startWaypoint: startWp,\n      endWaypoint: endWp,\n      distance,\n      difficulty: endWp.difficulty || \"moderate\",\n      warnings: segmentWarnings,\n      hazardCount: segmentWarnings.length,\n      instructionText: getDirectionInstruction(startWp, endWp, i),\n    });\n  }\n\n  return segments;\n};\n\nexport const calculateRouteStatistics = (\n  waypoints: Waypoint[],\n  segments: RouteSegment[],\n  estTime: number\n): RouteStatistics => {\n  const totalDistance = segments.reduce((sum, seg) => sum + seg.distance, 0);\n  const easyCount = segments.filter((s) => s.difficulty === \"easy\").length;\n  const moderateCount = segments.filter((s) => s.difficulty === \"moderate\").length;\n  const hardCount = segments.filter((s) => s.difficulty === \"hard\").length;\n  const totalHazards = segments.reduce((sum, seg) => sum + seg.hazardCount, 0);\n  const fuelStops = waypoints.filter((w) => w.poiType === \"fuel_stop\").length;\n  const scenic = waypoints.filter((w) => w.poiType === \"scenic_view\").length;\n  const safety = waypoints.filter((w) => w.poiType === \"safety_tip\").length;\n\n  const avgDifficulty =\n    hardCount > easyCount ? \"hard\" : hardCount > moderateCount ? \"moderate\" : \"easy\";\n\n  return {\n    totalDistance,\n    totalTime: estTime,\n    avgDifficulty,\n    easySegmentCount: easyCount,\n    moderateSegmentCount: moderateCount,\n    hardSegmentCount: hardCount,\n    totalWaypoints: waypoints.length,\n    hazardsOnRoute: totalHazards,\n    fuelsStopsAvailable: fuelStops,\n    scenicViewpoints: scenic,\n    safetyTips: safety,\n  };\n};\n\nexport const detectHazardsOnRoute = (\n  route: EnhancedNavigationRoute,\n  warnings: TrailWarning[]\n): TrailWarning[] => {\n  const routeHazards: TrailWarning[] = [];\n\n  for (const warning of warnings) {\n    for (const segment of route.segments) {\n      const distToStart = calculateDistance(segment.startWaypoint, warning.location);\n      const distToEnd = calculateDistance(segment.endWaypoint, warning.location);\n      if (distToStart + distToEnd <= segment.distance * 1.3) {\n        if (!routeHazards.find((h) => h.id === warning.id)) {\n          routeHazards.push(warning);\n        }\n        break;\n      }\n    }\n  }\n\n  return routeHazards;\n};\n\nexport const getAlternativeRouteOnHazard = (\n  currentRoute: EnhancedNavigationRoute,\n  hazardWarning: TrailWarning\n): string => {\n  if (currentRoute.type === \"safest\") {\n    return \"Route is designed to avoid hazards. Consider scenic or shortest route.\";\n  }\n  if (currentRoute.type === \"scenic\") {\n    return \"Hazard detected on scenic route. Switch to safest or shortest route.\";\n  }\n  if (currentRoute.type === \"shortest\") {\n    return \"Hazard on direct path. Switch to safest route for better protection.\";\n  }\n  return \"Hazard detected. Review alternative routes or wait for hazard to be cleared.\";\n};\n\nexport const saveFavoriteRoute = async (route: EnhancedNavigationRoute): Promise<void> => {\n  try {\n    const saved = await storage.getSavedRoutes();\n    const routeToSave: SavedRoute = {\n      id: route.id,\n      type: route.type,\n      waypoints: route.waypoints,\n      distance: route.distance,\n      difficulty: route.difficulty,\n      rating: route.rating,\n      userCount: route.userCount,\n      estTime: route.estTime,\n      description: route.description,\n      timestamp: Date.now(),\n    };\n    saved.push(routeToSave);\n    await storage.saveSavedRoutes(saved);\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error saving favorite route:\", error);\n    throw error;\n  }\n};\n\nexport const removeFavoriteRoute = async (routeId: string): Promise<void> => {\n  try {\n    const saved = await storage.getSavedRoutes();\n    const filtered = saved.filter((r) => r.id !== routeId);\n    await storage.saveSavedRoutes(filtered);\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error removing favorite route:\", error);\n    throw error;\n  }\n};\n\nexport const isFavoriteRoute = async (routeId: string): Promise<boolean> => {\n  try {\n    const saved = await storage.getSavedRoutes();\n    return saved.some((r) => r.id === routeId);\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(\"Error checking favorite route:\", error);\n    return false;\n  }\n};\n","size_bytes":7570},"src/server/storage.ts":{"content":"import { sql } from \"drizzle-orm\";\nimport { db } from \"./db\";\n\nexport class Storage {\n  async getProduct(productId: string) {\n    const result = await db.execute(\n      sql`SELECT * FROM stripe.products WHERE id = ${productId}`\n    );\n    return result.rows[0] || null;\n  }\n\n  async listProducts(active = true, limit = 20, offset = 0) {\n    const result = await db.execute(\n      sql`SELECT * FROM stripe.products WHERE active = ${active} LIMIT ${limit} OFFSET ${offset}`\n    );\n    return result.rows;\n  }\n\n  async listProductsWithPrices(active = true, limit = 20, offset = 0) {\n    const result = await db.execute(\n      sql`\n        WITH paginated_products AS (\n          SELECT id, name, description, metadata, active\n          FROM stripe.products\n          WHERE active = ${active}\n          ORDER BY id\n          LIMIT ${limit} OFFSET ${offset}\n        )\n        SELECT \n          p.id as product_id,\n          p.name as product_name,\n          p.description as product_description,\n          p.active as product_active,\n          p.metadata as product_metadata,\n          pr.id as price_id,\n          pr.unit_amount,\n          pr.currency,\n          pr.recurring,\n          pr.active as price_active,\n          pr.metadata as price_metadata\n        FROM paginated_products p\n        LEFT JOIN stripe.prices pr ON pr.product = p.id AND pr.active = true\n        ORDER BY p.id, pr.unit_amount\n      `\n    );\n    return result.rows;\n  }\n\n  async getPrice(priceId: string) {\n    const result = await db.execute(\n      sql`SELECT * FROM stripe.prices WHERE id = ${priceId}`\n    );\n    return result.rows[0] || null;\n  }\n\n  async listPrices(active = true, limit = 20, offset = 0) {\n    const result = await db.execute(\n      sql`SELECT * FROM stripe.prices WHERE active = ${active} LIMIT ${limit} OFFSET ${offset}`\n    );\n    return result.rows;\n  }\n\n  async getPricesForProduct(productId: string) {\n    const result = await db.execute(\n      sql`SELECT * FROM stripe.prices WHERE product = ${productId} AND active = true`\n    );\n    return result.rows;\n  }\n\n  async getSubscription(subscriptionId: string) {\n    const result = await db.execute(\n      sql`SELECT * FROM stripe.subscriptions WHERE id = ${subscriptionId}`\n    );\n    return result.rows[0] || null;\n  }\n}\n\nexport const storage = new Storage();\n","size_bytes":2309},"src/server/stripeService.ts":{"content":"import { storage } from './storage';\nimport { getUncachableStripeClient } from './stripeClient';\n\nexport class StripeService {\n  async createCustomer(email: string, userId: string) {\n    const stripe = await getUncachableStripeClient();\n    return await stripe.customers.create({\n      email,\n      metadata: { userId },\n    });\n  }\n\n  async createCheckoutSession(\n    customerId: string,\n    priceId: string,\n    successUrl: string,\n    cancelUrl: string\n  ) {\n    const stripe = await }\n}\n\nexport const stripeService = new StripeService();\n","size_bytes":1302},"seed-products.ts":{"content":"import { getUncachableStripeClient } from './src/server/stripeClient';\n\nasync function ScrollView, Pressable, Alert } from \"react-native\";\nimport { Feather } from \"@expo/vector-icons\";\nimport ThemedText from \"@/components/ThemedText\";\nimport { ThemedView } from \"@/components/ThemedView\";\nimport { useTheme } from \"@/hooks/useTheme\";\nimport { useSafeAreaInsets } from \"react-native-safe-area-context\";\nimport { useBottomTabBarHeight } from \"@react-navigation/bottom-tabs\";\nimport { Spacing, BorderRadius, Typography } from \"@/constants/theme\";\nimport { ScreenScrollView } from \"@/components/ScreenScrollView\";\n\ninterface PricingTier {\n  id: string;\n  name: string;\n  description: string;\n  priceId: string;\n  amount: number;\n  currency: string;\n  interval: string;\n  features: string[];\n  recommended?: boolean;\n  icon: keyof typeof import(\"@expo/vector-icons\").Feather.glyphMap;\n}\n\nexport default function PricingScreen() {\n  const { theme } = useTheme();\n  const insets = useSafeAreaInsets();\n  const tabBarHeight = useBottomTabBarHeight();\n  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);\n  const [tiers, setTiers] = useState<PricingTier[]>([\n    {\n      id: \"pro\",\n      name: \"Pro Offroader\",\n      description: \"Lifetime access\",\n      priceId: \"price_pro_one_time\",\n      amount: 4999,\n      currency: \"USD\",\n      interval: \"one-time\",\n      icon: \"shield\",\n      recommended: true,\n      features: [\n        \"Advanced AI Analysis\",\n        \"Offline Trail Maps\",\n        \"Premium Recovery Guides\",\n        \"Priority Support\",\n        \"Route Optimization\",\n        \"Hazard Alerts\",\n      ],\n    },\n    {\n      id: \"premium-monthly\",\n      name: \"Premium Monthly\",\n      description: \"Monthly updates\",\n      priceId: \"price_premium_monthly\",\n      amount: 999,\n      currency: \"USD\",\n      interval: \"month\",\n      icon: \"zap\",\n      features: [\n        \"All Pro Features\",\n        \"Monthly Trail Updates\",\n        \"Expert Support\",\n        \"Advanced Analytics\",\n        \"Route History\",\n        \"Group Coordination\",\n      ],\n    },\n    {\n      id: \"premium-yearly\",\n      name: \"Premium Yearly\",\n      description: \"Save 25%\",\n      priceId: \"price_premium_yearly\",\n      amount: 8999,\n      currency: \"USD\",\n      interval: \"year\",\n      icon: \"star\",\n      features: [\n        \"All Premium Features\",\n        \"Annual Savings\",\n        \"VIP Support\",\n        \"Advanced Analytics\",\n        \"Route History\",\n        \"Group Coordination\",\n      ],\n    },\n  ]);\n\n  const formatPrice = (amount: number) => {\n    return `$${(amount / 100).toFixed(2)}`;\n  };\n\n  const handlePurchase = async (tier: PricingTier) => {\n    setLoading(true);\n    try {\n      Alert.alert(\n        \"Purchase\",\n        `Purchase ${tier.name} for ${formatPrice(tier.amount)}/${tier.interval}?`,\n        [\n          { text: \"Cancel\", onPress: () => setLoading(false), style: \"cancel\" },\n          {\n            text: \"Proceed\",\n            onPress: async () => {\n              // In production, this would call your checkout endpoint\n              Alert.alert(\n                \"Coming Soon\",\n                \"Payment processing is being integrated. Check back soon!\"\n              );\n              setLoading(false);\n            },\n          },\n        ]\n      );\n    } catch (error) {\n      Alert.alert(\"Error\", \"Failed to process purchase\");\n      setLoading(false);\n    }\n  };\n\n  return (\n    <ScreenScrollView style={[styles.container, { backgroundColor: theme.backgroundDefault }]}>\n      <View style={styles.header}>\n        <Feather name=\"credit-card\" size={32} color={theme.primary} />\n        <ThemedText style={[Typography.h2, styles.title]}>\n          Unlock Premium Features\n        </ThemedText>\n        <ThemedText style={[styles.subtitle, { color: theme.tabIconDefault }]}>\n          Choose the plan that fits your adventure\n        </ThemedText>\n      </View>\n\n      <View style={styles.tiersContainer}>\n        {tiers.map((tier) => (\n          <Pressable\n            key={tier.id}\n            onPress={() => handlePurchase(tier)}\n            disabled={loading}\n          >\n            <View\n              style={[\n                styles.tierCard,\n                {\n                  backgroundColor: tier.recommended ? theme.primary : theme.backgroundDefault,\n                  borderColor: tier.recommended ? theme.primary : theme.backgroundSecondary,\n                  borderWidth: 2,\n                },\n              ]}\n            >\n              {tier.recommended && (\n                <View\n                  style={[\n                    styles.recommendedBadge,\n                    { backgroundColor: theme.success },\n                  ]}\n                >\n                  <ThemedText style={[styles.badgeText, { color: \"#fff\" }]}>\n                    Recommended\n                  </ThemedText>\n                </View>\n              )}\n\n              <View style={styles.tierHeader}>\n                <Feather\n                  name={tier.icon as any}\n                  size={28}\n                  color={tier.recommended ? \"#fff\" : theme.primary}\n                />\n                <View style={{ flex: 1 }}>\n                  <ThemedText\n                    style={[\n                      Typography.h4,\n                      {\n                        color: tier.recommended ? \"#fff\" : theme.text,\n                        marginBottom: Spacing.xs,\n                      },\n                    ]}\n                  >\n                    {tier.name}\n                  </ThemedText>\n                  <ThemedText\n                    style={{\n                      fontSize: 12,\n                      color: tier.recommended ? \"@/constants/theme\";\nimport { storage, CommunityTip } from \"@/utils/storage\";\n\ninterface WarningType {\n  id: string;\n  label: string;\n  icon: string;\n  description: string;\n}\n\nconst WARNING_TYPES: WarningType[] = [\n  {\n    id: \"police\",\n    label: \"Police\",\n    icon: \"shield\",\n    description: \"Law enforcement present\",\n  },\n  {\n    id: \"probation\",\n    label: \"Probation Officer\",\n    icon: \"alert-circle\",\n    description: \"Probation/parole officer spotted\",\n  },\n  {\n    id: \"mud\",\n    label: \"Deep Mud\",\n    icon: \"droplet\",\n    description: \"Muddy trail conditions\",\n  },\n  {\n    id: \"water\",\n    label: \"Water Hazard\",\n    icon: \"wave-2\",\n    description: \"Flooded or wet sections\",\n  },\n  {\n    id: \"rocks\",\n    label: \"Rocky\",\n    icon: \"zap\",\n    description: \"Large rocks and obstacles\",\n  },\n  {\n    id: \"snow\",\n    label: \"Snow/Ice\",\n    icon: \"cloud-snow\",\n    description: \"Snow or ice on trail\",\n  },\n  {\n    id: \"blocked\",\n    label: \"Blocked\",\n    icon: \"x-circle\",\n    description: \"Trail impassable\",\n  },\n  {\n    id: \"damage\",\n    label: \"Damage\",\n    icon: \"alert-triangle\",\n    description: \"Trail damage reported\",\n  },\n];\n\ninterface ReportConditionModalProps {\n  visible: boolean;\n  onClose: () => void;\n  userLocation: any;\n  userProfile: any;\n  onReportSubmitted: () => void;\n}\n\nexport default function ReportConditionModal({\n  visible,\n  onClose,\n  userLocation,\n  userProfile,\n  onReportSubmitted,\n}: ReportConditionModalProps) {\n  const { theme } = useTheme();\n  const [selectedWarning, setSelectedWarning] = useState<string | null>(null);\n  const [isSubmitting, setIsSubmitting] = useState(false);\n\n  const handleSubmit = async () => {\n    if (!selectedWarning || !userLocation) {\n      Alert.alert(\"Error\", \"Please select a warning type and ensure location is available\");\n      return;\n    }\n\n    setIsSubmitting(true);\n\n    const warningType = WARNING_TYPES.find((w) => w.id === selectedWarning);\n    if (!warningType) return;\n\n    const tip: CommunityTip = {\n      id: `tip_${Date.now()}`,\n      title: warningType.label,\n      description: warningType.description,\n      category: \"trail_condition\",\n      timestamp: Date.now(),\n      location: {\n        latitude: userLocation.coords.latitude,\n        longitude: userLocation.coords.longitude,\n      },\n      author: {\n        name: userProfile?.name || \"Anonymous\",\n        vehicleType: userProfile?.vehicleType || \"Unknown\",\n      },\n      helpful: 0,\n    };\n\n    try {\n      await storage.saveCommunityTip(tip);\n      Alert.alert(\"Success\", \"Thank you! Your report helps other offroaders stay safe.\");\n      setSelectedWarning(null);\n      onReportSubmitted();\n      onClose();\n    } catch (error) {\n      Alert.alert(\"Error\", \"Failed to submit report. Please try again.\");\n      console.error(\"Error submitting report:\", error);\n    } finally {\n      setIsSubmitting(false);\n    }\n  };\n\n  return (\n    <Modal\n      visible={visible}\n      transparent\n      animationType=\"slide\"\n      onRequestClose={onClose}\n    >\n      <View style={[styles.container, { backgroundColor: \"rgba(0,0,0,0.5)\" }]}>\n        <View\n          style={[\n            styles.content,\n            { backgroundColor: theme.backgroundDefault },\n          ]}\n        >\n          <View style={styles.header}>\n            <ThemedText style={[Typography.h3, styles.title]}>\n              Report Trail Condition\n            </ThemedText>\n            <Pressable onPress={onClose} style={styles.closeButton}>\n              <Feather name=\"x\" size={24} color={theme.tabIconDefault} />\n            </Pressable>\n          </View>\n\n          <ThemedText style={[styles.subtitle, { color: theme.tabIconDefault }]}>\n            Alert other offroaders about what you've encountered\n          </ThemedText>\n\n          <ScrollView style={styles.warningList} showsVerticalScrollIndicator={false}>\n            {WARNING_TYPES.map((warning) => (\n              <Pressable\n                key={warning.id}\n                style={[\n                  styles.warningOption,\n                  {\n                    backgroundColor: theme.backgroundSecondary,\n                    borderColor:\n                      selectedWarning === warning.id\n                        ? theme.primary\n                          : \"transparent\",\n                    },\n                  ]}\n                >\n                  <Feather\n                    name={warning.icon as any}\n                    size={24}\n                    color={\n                      selectedWarning === warning.id\n                        ? theme.buttonText\n                        : theme.primary\n                    }\n                  />\n                </View>\n                <View style={styles.warningInfo}>\n                  <ThemedText style={styles.warningLabel}>\n                    {warning.label}\n                  </ThemedText>\n                  <ThemedText\n                    style={[\n                      styles.warningDescription,\n                      { color: theme.tabIconDefault },\n                    ]}\n                  >\n                    {warning.description}\n                  </ThemedText>\n                </View>\n              </Pressable>\n            ))}\n          </ScrollView>\n\n          <View style={styles.buttonContainer}>\n            <Pressable\n              style={[styles.button, { backgroundColor: theme.backgroundSecondary }]}\n              onPress={onClose}\n              disabled={isSubmitting}\n            >\n              <ThemedText style={styles.buttonText}>Cancel</ThemedText>\n            </Pressable>\n            <Pressable\n              style={[\n                styles.button,\n                {\n                  backgroundColor: theme.primary,\n                  opacity: selectedWarning ?  location: TrailLocation;\n  difficulty: \"Easy\" | \"Moderate\" | \"Hard\" | \"Expert\";\n  distance: number;\n  duration: number;\n  landType: \"public\" | \"private\" | \"mixed\";\n  description: string;\n  elevation: number;\n  features: string[];\n  vehicleTypes: string[];\n  safetyRating: number;\n  popularity: number;\n}\n\nexport interface Route {\n  id: string;\n  name: string;\n  trails: Trail[];\n  startLocation: TrailLocation;\n  endLocation: TrailLocation;\n  totalDistance: number;\n  totalDuration: number;\n  difficulty: \"Easy\" | \"Moderate\" | \"Hard\" | \"Expert\";\n  description: string;\n}\n\nexport const SAMPLE_TRAILS: Trail[] = [\n  {\n    id: \"trail_1\",\n    name: \"Moab Rim Trail\",\n    location: { latitude: 38.5729, longitude: -109.5898 },\n
